Setup was simple. The installation CD had the program IP Camera Wizard which made setup very easy. It took 5 minutes or less.Viewing was easy on my MacBook Pro Retina running OS X Lion. The camera provided an unassigned ActiveX plugin for Internet Explorer. I can install it but IE didn't permit me to run it since it was unsigned. On my iPhone, I used CamViewer (a free app).They provide a DDNS host name but I also wish there was an option to turn it off.

Reviews.Title: HooToo Wireless Network IP Camera
Reviews.Author: White-Out Reviews "White-Out Reviews"
Reviews.Content: HooToo Wireless Network IP Camera. I have added a link above so you can check it out at their site.Out of the box, this IP Network Camera is intense! I love the look of it and how it has a fully rotatable head. You have two options for the network, you can either have it wired in or wireless. I found that setting the IP Camera up on the hard wired connection was easier than if I tried with the wireless. The camera housing has plenty of IR so you can see just as well at night as you can during the day.Don't get too scared that when you plug in your IP Network Camera it starts to rotate like someone else is controlling it. This is just the camera calibrating itself to a centered position. Once you set it up and you can view from your computer, you can then access the controls to move the camera in any direction you want.I had some troubles getting it to work through Internet Explorer, so make sure you read the directions very thoroughly. My problem was thinking I had all the Active X settings enabled, but found after trying a few times that I needed to check those settings out. To be honest, it was my fiancé who thoroughly read the instructions and gave me hope as she enabled all of the settings. After she enabled everything and we refreshed Internet Explorer we were set!The crisp color and the image quality of this camera is fantastic! When the lights are on, you can more than identify the perpetrator in your home, but you could also see who is sneaking all those beers from the fridge. The quality of this camera at night is just as good, so you can monitor day or night and verify that only the wild animals are roaming around while you are gone.You can have two way voice communication as well, which makes this device even more amazing for the price. As long as you have a microphone, you can project your voice to those people in your house without authorization. Eliminate the threat of a teenage party and broken glass all over the house, and if need be you can yell at those teenage kids all the way from France!Having this little device up and running definitely makes me feel more secure in our home. Being able to check out what's going on, no matter where as long as you have an internet connection makes this device ultimate. You can set it up so that it starts to record on a motion detection setting. Setup for any of these options are very easy, as they are given to you once you are logged into the IP Network Camera.The HooToo Wireless Network IP Camera only requires power to be connected to it, other than that it can function wirelessly. If you don't have a wireless router at this point and you still have a wired network, this will require an extra cable running from the camera. I think it looks absolutely fine in the corner up on the wall, and really isn't noticeable unless you glance over. The only thing to give this camera away, is the red light letting you know its functioning.I also just want to reiterate to read the instructions fully and thoroughly. Everything works perfect if you follow the right steps. If you think you know what you are doing and something isn't going right, consult the manual and take a breather.If you are looking for that little extra security at home, or you have been the victim of any break ins, or even if you are just paranoid of the zombie apocalypse, this is a great buy! I definitely give the HooToo Wireless Network IP Camera the White-Out stamp of approval. This camera gets the job done, and with grace. Having the camera connected to my network wirelessly I still don't have too much lag between what happens on camera and when it shows up on my live feed.You have plenty of options to make sure this Network IP Camera caters to you, so if you are interested in picking up that extra security, I say do it!

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Julie M Farley
Reviews.Content: This was really easy to set up < 30 min and we are not tech savvy.  the wireless is a great option for us as it allows us to move it all over the house (important with a new baby!).  it has great picture quality and audio capabilities.  my one recommendation would be the addition of a zoom option.overall very pleased - highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Blown Away!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best IP Camera I have used in this price range.  Actually, it's half the price I've paid for other IP Cameras that don't have near the features of the HooToo 210.  Installation was simple and straight forward.  I ran the utilities directly from the supplied disk and my camera was found and easily configured from there.  The Active X file could be a problem if your security settings are set too high. It's an easy fix on IE.  Currently using the camera as a crib cam.  The night vision works well and is easily adjusted by changing the brightness setting. The camera is larger than I thought it would be, but that is not an issue.  Pan and tilt funtions are smoothe and silent.  The 320 degree pan is impressive.  There is a setting to control the Pan/Tilt speed.  Built in DDNS saves a lot of time not having to configure or pay for a DDNS service. I use an Android device and monitor the camera using an app called Tiny IP Cam Pro, I think it was $3 and allows me to control every aspect of this camera.  The built in mic works good and I can monitor audio from anywhere. The only con I have is that the speaker on the camera is really loud and distorts easily. I've tried an external speaker, but still got the distortion.  As for the "review request card" it doesn't ask for a positive or 5 star review, it just ask's you to review the product.  The offer a 10% gift card for a review, but as far as I'm concerned they can keep it because they can't be making much on this camera at this price point.  The reverse side of the review request card has their 100% Satisfaction Guarantee and a zero defect statement.  I'll be getting a couple more of these to replace my other IP cams.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Josh T.
Reviews.Content: Hard to set up..but awesome once it started working;) The night vision is a bit, eh..but who cares. It was $70 and I would buy multiple if I needed to...Get this camera

Reviews.Title: Cheap and Easy to setup the camera
Reviews.Author: Sharad Unni
Reviews.Content: The only issue i had was setting up SMTP which was more of a UI usability issue on the web interface and lack of documentation.I really loved the hardware though there can be a lot of improvement that can be done on the Software front. What will be interesting is if they make the camera firmware and the web interface code open source or give SDK's to develop applications on top of this it will be a nice to have feature and will drastically improve the marketing of the product and will sell these hardware like hot cake. The example is Android how it has set an example.But overall the product is what is advertised and works.

Reviews.Title: Not what i expected
Reviews.Author: M. J. Mathias "Matt"
Reviews.Content: The camera operates, looks great and arrived promptly. If you are not a major tech head its amazingly confusing to set up and use. the directions that came with it are just about useless, I have the camera working but only on my home network, i have no web access to it because I have no idea and it wasnt mentioned in any of the books it came with or the description when i bought it about having a router set up for port forwarding, I never heard of it. after watching several vids on youtube and buying different router months later and its still not working, sent email to there tech support and all they said is its probubly a port forwarding issue, which i allready know. Its a nice camera and i wish i could get it to work but for now its a paperweight. There is a third party program for yet another 30 bucks that claims it will take care of port forwarding automatically that i have not tried because i dont know if it actually delivers on that promise. good luck.UPDATE: Within 24hrs of the posting of this review I was contacted via email from the company who has offered to in my opinion go above and beyond to help me with the problems i've had with this camera, this is unexpected and I'm hoping for the best, I will Update.

Reviews.Title: Good value for money
Reviews.Author: Barcrofter
Reviews.Content: These little IP cameras are incredible value for money.  The Hootoo IP210F appears to be a clone of the Foscam camera at about the same price.  If you read the installation quick start carefully you should have no problem getting it installed and working either on a LAN or wifi connection.  To view the video remotely you will need to use a DDNS service and they provide one as part of the package but you can use any alternative.  The video works reasonably well over my 1 Mbit upload country internet link, I can pan in real time.  Remember this is an SD image not an HD.The camera is viewed using a web browser so it is OS neutral.  I use a mac, a win8 PC and also a cell phone browser.  The mobile app is tricky to use largely because the control buttons on the browser image are so small, but it can view the video and pan around under your control.One thing I couldn't figure out is how to link the camera to my MiCasaVerde home automation system, even tho it appears to be a clone of a Foscam camera that can be linked.I have it parked in a corner of my cabin allowing it to pan the interior.  It would make a great baby monitor because it is quiet.  The motion sensor will send a batch of 6 images to your email address.  Im thinking of installing one in the basement to check for leaks and monitor my water supply.

Reviews.Title: Okay for the money
Reviews.Author: Steven C. Henry
Reviews.Content: The unit has a lot of features for the money. Software isn't as good as other cameras, and had some issues with lockup on WiFi.It appears to work fine wired.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: bpr
Reviews.Content: We bought a couple of these as baby monitors for our kids.  One was sent with the wrong AC adapter, but a simple email back to the seller and we had the new AC adapter a couple of days later.  Setup was easy-ish, you do have to follow the instructions by adding it via wire connection before connecting via wifi, but it was relatively quick and painless.  Image quality is decent, but great for the price and it works like a charm at night.  Good customer service as well.  If you're looking for a pan/tilt camera, this one is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: Perfect addition that also integrates with my Crestron Automation System
Reviews.Author: mackenzie martin
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as my first network camera.  I am impressed.  I was able to setup the camera within an hour.  After playing with the settings, I was able to setup my email alert settings, ftp image upload settings, wireless network, etc.I also set up the alarm relay to trigger my x10 lighting system to turn on the house lights if it see's movement during the scheduled motion detection.the resolution of 640x480 worked great.  The ptz is very quiet and you can set the speed of the ptz to work super fast.  I was very pleased.  Going to buy the outdoor ptz camera next.

Reviews.Title: Apple users beware - misleading advertising
Reviews.Author: Wheezy
Reviews.Content: Hi allI intended to use this as a baby monitor for our upcoming little one's arrival. This means we need the audio capabilities. Before I added this to our baby registry, I made certain Safari was supported. The settings on this page read, "Browser: IE 6.0/ 7.0/ 8.0, Firefox, Safari, Google Chrome, etc" and assumed this meant this camera is mac friendly.After many frustrations and headaches I contacted customer support. Here is their response: "Yes, the sound function is only available on IE browser, due to the active-x plug in it works with." So this advertisement is literally misleading. Their description never once mentioned that sound is only available on Internet Explorer via the ActiveX plugin. Now I am stuck with a useless camera. I have contacted customer support for a refund. I am not certain if that is even possible since we received this as a gift off of our baby registry.Again, if you own and use Apple products, this is NOT the IP camera for you. It will not work and the only instructions customer support will send you are for use in a PC environment.

Reviews.Title: gets the job done
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: This camera adequately performs the job of watching around my house. The software is clunky, but serviceable, and the image is mediocre, but visible.

Reviews.Title: Does its job
Reviews.Author: Kenneth L. Kendrick
Reviews.Content: Have had software issues since I bought this camera. The camera itself works fine. Setting it up seems to be the biggest issue.

Reviews.Title: Not good.  Support was good, though.
Reviews.Author: AllThingsTech "JustBeNice"
Reviews.Content: Product simply didn't work.  I was able to get in touch with their support, they were helpful.  But, I return the camera.

Reviews.Title: but it would be a good feature. HooToo provides a free iOS app to ...
Reviews.Author: Darryl P. Howard
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to help provide some level of security following a break in. The camera can be set up to send email alerts, with still photos, if it detects motion. This feature works well and I have been "caught" several times when I have forgotten to turn off the motion detection feature. As this is my main reason for purchasing the camera, I feel that it earns a four-star review.However, the camera is not without issues. The initial configuration did not go smoothly, and I was not able to use the setup wizard to detect and configure the camera. I wound up assigning a static IP address through my router so that I could access the configuration page.While the camera can be configured to upload still pictures to an FTP site when it detects motion, it will only record video if its interface is open on a computer at the time motion is detected. This is not a big issue, but it would be a good feature.HooToo provides a free iOS app to monitor the camera on your iPhone. However, the version I have only works when you are connected to the same network as the camera, so it's not very useful. I was able to find another generic IP camera app that accepted the DDNS site I set up to view the camera feed over the Internet.The camera has a built-in microphone and speaker designed to allow you to hear what is going on in your house and allow you to be heard. However, in testing this feature the volume levels on both ends of the conversation was so low that this feature is nearly useless. I've never used this after the initial testing.If you purchase this camera (or any other IP camera for that matter), make sure that your first step is to change the admin password! There are ways to search the Internet for IP cameras, and if you do not change your password your camera may be used to spy on you.I purchased the camera for $54.99, but it is now selling for $15 more. Personally I would not buy it at the current price. There are many IP cameras available at lower prices, and all seem to offer similar features.

Reviews.Title: Well worth it !
Reviews.Author: Dave Parent

logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo13U7Z1N2TSPQGcurrentClick) { return cv_mo13U7Z1N2TSPQGcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 3:56 MinsThe Review:The packaging, is a box which shows a picture of the HooToo HT-IP210F IP Wired/Wireless Network IP Camera with features and specifications as well as retail pictures on the boxThe camera does have an identifying mark on it which is the HooToo logo This camera is best affordable IP camera to get the job done inside in my opinion...The camera does come with an Instruction manual in English,quick guide , CD for mac and PC and comment card as well a CAT 5 cable and camera mounting kit this camera is the easiest to set up and the Instruction booklet is very clear to help out the picture quality is better than most other cheaper IP cameras out there right now the night vision works better then other cameras I have it's just like looking through your own eyes I use a iPad app to manage the multi camera lookConclusion:So yes the camera is inexpensive , but is it even worth it? I would say yes if you want to check up on your front door or maybe your driveway The camera is very well made and does a night/day mode where you can also see at night-time and even better then most cheeper night vision cameras if you are looking for a camera with zoom this camera won't do that it will pan and tilt just as it says as well if you have alarm system you will also be able to hook this up to it I didn't find the need to mess with this there was also one big flaw with this camera which is the red indicator light on the front which transmits info to the router its directly in front so if you have it pointing on a driveway someone might be able to see this camera in the windowSo in all it's not bad for a budget IP camera but if you want to have to have zoom for this camera I would look into another camera otherwise you will like this budget cameraThe final score averages out to be a 10 out of 10, but that takes into account everything,

Reviews.Title: Worth the price
Reviews.Author: joecool_83
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived as described. The box does contain a picture of a black camera, but inside was the white model that I had ordered. The setup of the camera was quite difficult, but once I had it up and running it worked to its specifications. I was able to view my dogs and speak to them over the camera from my laptop. I did not however try using my iphone. I am selling mine on amazon not because of the product itself, but my browser kept crashing while it was running. Overall I would recommend this product for the price for a tech savvy individual.

Reviews.Title: One of the most complicated cameras I have ever used
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Lavoie
Reviews.Content: I wanted to like this camera based on it's ratings, but I just hated it and returned it within days of receiving it. It's SO complicated to set up - and I do consider myself to have decent computer knowledge. I'm on a Mac and the website itself was terrible for viewing the camera when I did finally get it up and running 2 hours later. I never figured out how to make the two way talk function work, there was never an option for it online or on the app on my phone. Camera quality was only so-so. I also couldn't get the audio to work - so using it as a baby monitor was completely useless because I couldn't even hear my 2 year old in his room. As stated, this went back within days of having it. One of the worst monitors I've tried yet.

Reviews.Title: Great PTZ IP Camera!
Reviews.Author: Numb3rTech "Sonya Ann"
Reviews.Content: So far, I highly recommend this camera!  I needed a PTZ camera to replace an old one.  One requirement is compatibility with the IR flood lights I recently started using.  This camera does it all.  After unpacking the unit and reading the manuals, I connected the camera and loaded up my router controls.  I designated the IP address and other ports, then loaded up the Blue Iris monitoring software.  I ran an update on the Blue Iris software and this particular camera was included in the list.  I entered the routing data and the camera started showing up immediately.  I edited a couple of the settings in the software and everything was up and running correctly.  The pan and tilt features on the camera are great.  Even the camera mic worked!  I do not have a mic on my computer to test the 2 way communication, but am sure it will work.  The software included with the camera is okay too.  If you are using this camera to monitor large areas at night, I do recommend the IR floods.  I got tired of having huge regular flood lights on full time, plus these can be powered by 12vdc.  The Blue Iris also lets you be very specific on motion triggers.  I just received this camera this evening and will include pictures and video in an update in a few weeks.  After testing, I will be ordering more of the HooToo surveillance cameras soon!This is the software I use: Foscam Blue Iris Professional Surveillance Software - Up to 64 Cameras, SMS/Text Message Alerts, H.264 Encoding, Supports most major IP Camera brands and CCTV SystemsThese are the IR floods - I use 2 that make my back yard bright as day at night: CMVision IR130 - 198 LED Indoor/Outdoor Long Range 300-400ft IR Illuminator With Free 3A 12VDC Adaptor

Reviews.Title: It Worked Better Than I Expected - Very Nice Product
Reviews.Author: sherri
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera.  The installation went smoothly with careful attention to the instructions; it took us about 45 minutes to set up in wireless mode.  The picture quality is really good and the audio feature works well too; the audio seems to be only available with the internet explorer window (not in firefox or the cell phone windows).  The picture update rate is about 5-10 frames per second in internet explorer and about once per second through a cell phone browser connection.  Really nice to scan the inside of our house from anywhere using the cell phone.  We installed this in my Mom's house; I think I will buy one for us too. :)

Reviews.Title: No Problem
Reviews.Author: MickyT
Reviews.Content: I like the HooToo cameras this is my third one and I have had good results with all of them.  Once you get past original learning curve all of these type of cameras are somewhat easy to set up,again once past learning curve.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!
Reviews.Author: Ray Beauvais
Reviews.Content: It has a lousy interface that requires 'Unsigned' and "untrusted publisher" ActiveX scripts be allowed to run in IE. It then constantly crashes IE every time you attempt to make configuration changes. IE is also the only browser that allows recording, logging, etc. (firefox and chrome are usable but only allow a snapshot.)Getting the wireless to work was also a joke:"HooToo models usually don't deal well with long/complex (with symbols or accents) SSID's and shared keys(passwords), so keep them simple and short"In short, the product requires the user to completely compromise their computer security in order to use the camera wirelessly.Would not recommend purchasing this camera.

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive quality camera
Reviews.Author: J. Hurt "hurtman"
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera with decent 2 way audio. If you are familiar with setting up a Foscam camera, this one is very similar. I had an issue with the first camera but customer support was excellent. It was quickly replaced and I had no problems with the new one. I would purchase another HooToo camera.

Reviews.Title: great can for the price!
Reviews.Author: Chuck Lawler
Reviews.Content: I have this working in central location to see the whole house main living area!Has great pan or can set the vpresets for exact camera position!I'm very happy with the way it works and the price ,and the customer service HooToo supplied when I needed help getting setup!!

Reviews.Title: Absolutely love it! Mounted on the front porch
Reviews.Author: Lakov
Reviews.Content: This IP cam has survived negative temperatures here in Kentucky this winter. I don't have it out in the open of course, it's in the corner of my front porch and it works like a charm. I set up a FTP server using Windows 7 and now have pictures getting sent to it every time it detects movement. The mic and speakers are junky and inaudible. I can't find anything better with speakers actually built-in. Get this IP cam for sure!!

Reviews.Title: Hoo Too Wireless Camera
Reviews.Author: scott rideout
Reviews.Content: Okay camera for the money.  Does what is intended.  Time consuming set up even for my computer wiz nephew.  I would recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Camera Bought
Reviews.Author: Diane T.
Reviews.Content: I called the customer service and they helped me with the download of this program. They walked me through this and got it going.The camera works well. I would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Perfect device
Reviews.Author: Sae Jae Oh
Reviews.Content: super excellent device with reasonable low price. it was little bit hard to configure IP on IE 10 but works well on other web browser like goolge chorme.Recording function is excellent too but low quality of pictures recorded.strongly recommend this product as a low priced best device

Reviews.Title: Much needed security problem taken care of
Reviews.Author: Billy
Reviews.Content: We now have two of these on our front enclosed porch and they did the trick the neighborhood bully who was poisoning our pets has stopped and they leave us completely alone as a matter of fact the entire neighborhood has left us alone which is what we were seeking so I definitely give this product a thumbs up - if you have neighborhood problems these will put a stop to it. Also hook up was easy we struggled a bit with the first camera but the second one was a breeze the only down side is the actual controls like record and audio are through IE and you must have active x controls on but to fix this we bought a cheap PC laptop just for these, you can view through mac but no controls although we have our mac talk with our PC and we can view the videos and all that through our mac - super easy once you get to know the software and what to do and their customer service was agreeable.

Reviews.Title: Great Value for the Price!
Reviews.Author: Roger K.
Reviews.Content: I'm already using 3 Hootoo PTZ Outdoor cameras which work very well. This is my first indoor camera from them (using currently Foscam cameras), and also this one works like a charm! The setup - as for all IP cameras of that kind - can be cumbersome to someone who is not used to router configurations etc. But then again, the instructions provided are easy to follow, and once you get the hang of it, the setup doesn't take more than 15 minutes.Image quality is good (again, 0.3MP don't do wonders, but that's what all cameras in this price range have), I'm operating my cameras using Chrome on Mac OS and TinyCam Pro on Android. No problem on either of these, there is no need to install any ActiveX plugins when using Chrome, so that's a plus point as well.Bottom line: built quality is good, PTZ mechanics seem very solid. Given the price tag, I think you cannot beat this camera. In addition, I had great experience with Hootoo customer support for one of my other Outdoor Cameras. So definitely a recommendation!

Reviews.Title: Much better than expected!
Reviews.Author: Alex T. Jensen "Alex"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a nursery camera. Must haves were Pan/Tilt, Nightvision, and at least 1 way audio (this camera has 2 way). Setup was quick and easy. The Pan/Tilt range is awesome and silent. I was super impressed by the night vision (it was so crisp my camera thought the camera was emitting light, it wasnt).If this camera holds up over time it will be the best IP camera I've purchased.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: This camera is great.  A bit tricky to set up for remote viewing but there are so many YouTube videos and info on the web to help. Well worth the time to set up. I liked it so much I bought the new HooToo outdoor camera and another IP210F for inside. Great cameras and fair price. I would absolutely recommend these cameras.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Mike Ransom
Reviews.Content: I bought this to use as a way to check in on the house if an alarm was triggered.  I have used both the web interface and the iPhone app with out any issues both across the internet or at home.  The camera works great in day and night mode.  I set the camera up in a corner of a room.  I am able to move the camera with the webpage or app to see any place I want in the room.So far no problems with it.  I am thinking about buying a second one for another room.If you want to use it from the internet you will need to setup port forwarding on your router to point port 80 to the camera and know your internet IP address.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the money
Reviews.Author: MrMoto
Reviews.Content: Doesn't have better than VGA resolution, but a terrific camera for the money. Vert impressive IR performance also. Works with many free ipad apps as well.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Ssmowers S.
Reviews.Content: The camera is good quality and the picture is fine. The only reason rating is not higher is setting the unit up was a real job. Its not plug and  play. I really would have like a IP camera with a zoom,which this is not. I didnt know that would be important until we set it up. Overall product is good.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera and Excellent Tech support
Reviews.Author: Brandon Guske
Reviews.Content: Out of the box, follow the directions and your up and running. Only reason I had to call Tech support is I didn't wait long enough for the camera to save and reboot.. First camera and I must admit, I'm impressed especially for the price..

Reviews.Title: Great product to purchase
Reviews.Author: Sherry L Slaughter
Reviews.Content: I purchased a HooToo based on Amazon reviews, and because it looked like a plug and play device. I was wrong about plug and play, but oh so right to call the tech support number.  That's where the 5 star rating comes in.  I gave the technician permission to remote access my computer, he explained everything he was doing, and had the camera set up in minutes.  Now I can't stay off the thing!  It's a live feed that I can access from my computer or mobile phone app, the picture is clear, I can get a wide view of access doors and windows in my home, and it's so quiet its movement does not disturb my sleeping dog (security?).  I am very pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great web-cam
Reviews.Author: Robert Marvin
Reviews.Content: I was given this particular camera as a gift. It was little tricky to set up. However, the excellent support provided over the phone was all it took to get everything in synch. It works GREAT! I couldn't be more pleased. When we are on the road, we can log on and monitor what is going on. I am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: HooToo camera is great for the price point!!
Reviews.Author: Matthew D. Meehan "TV Guru!!"
Reviews.Content: I am an IT guy and was looking for a cheap ip camera to keep an eye on my dog at home. So i ordered this camera after seeing all of the great reviews it has gotten. I setup a bunch of high end camera's at the construction sites so I am aware of what the high priced camera's have as far as options. I will say this for the price you are definetely getting your money's worth. This camera is a piece of cake to setup. No issues getting to it via cellphone and the picture quality is pretty good. The night vision was much better than I expected and the pan and tilt works very well remotely. I have had this up and running for about 5 days and I am very pleased with the product. This camera is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Want more
Reviews.Author: Thomas
Reviews.Content: This cam was so easy to install . Just wish it was battery powered & LEDs were a bit brighter . Can't have everything.

Reviews.Title: love this product
Reviews.Author: Lyndsey B.
Reviews.Content: works better than i though it would, hard to install but the guy at the hootoo tech call center was more than helpful every time i called and knew what he was talking about, cant wait to get one for outside

Reviews.Title: Decent IR, PTZ as expected, easy setup, not so great in dusk conditions before IR kicks on
Reviews.Author: dccordell
Reviews.Content: So this is a pretty decent camera for this price range. I bought two of these a couple months ago after my neighborhood was having multiple breaks-ins and thefts before the Christmas holiday. I decided to put up a couple of these cameras to give us some fighting power if our house was targeted for theft.The setup is fairly straight-forward, even if the directions don't make it seem so. Basically, hook this thing up to your network with the cable, plug it in, and run the little IP-Cam utility that comes with the cameras. This will find the camera's IP address on your network so you can find it. Once you know the address, navigate to it in your browser (ex: [...]), and this will allow you to change the settings in the camera to suit your home network, such as WiFi, DHCP, etc. Once all that is setup, just unplug the network cable from the camera and it will hook back up to your network wirelessly.One of the two cameras had a problem with the night vision. It just wouldn't come on, and all I could see was darkness. It seems that the IR lights were simply not coming on. So I contacted HooToo and they immediately sent another camera (didn't even ask for the old one to be returned, so now I use it with an external IR light bought from Amazon for ~$12). The replacement works great, so you can expect great customer service out of HooToo.The only complaint I have with these cameras is that they aren't so great in those times when the light is getting dim, but not dark enough to kick on the IR lights and filter. It seems like during these times, occasionally the camera will adjust it's brightness/color/etc to show the image, but then it goes away, and I haven't been able to find a good solution for this yet. That is why I only rated the cameras 4-stars.For those curious, I use my cameras as motion detectors while we are away from home. I don't use the built-in camera software to achieve this as it is too limited. I use iSpyConnect. It's free, runs on an always-on computer in your home, and will monitor the cameras for any movement whenever you have it enabled to do so. It also has a great mobile browser version that allows you turn the camera monitoring on and off. I just turn it on when we leave the house, and turn it back off when we get home (sometimes I forget and the cameras see us in the house and my phone starts blowing up because of the detected motion, haha). Upon motion detection, it will save a snapshot of the motion to my Dropbox account, so even if the intruder steals my laptop, the image is on the internet and I'll have it, same with the video recording. It's a pretty good solution, and is entirely free unless you want to pay for text alerts (hint: you can send a text to yourself using your carrier's email-text address, such as for Verizon, it would be 5551231234@vtext.com, similar for at&t;).And if the IR lights aren't wide-spread enough for you, think about getting an external IR light to mount beside the camera. I use one that is about $12 here on Amazon and it works pretty well. I use this outside so I can see further away at a wider angle.Hope this helps! Overall, very pleased and impressed with a camera in this price range with so many good features.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT CAMERA FOR BASIC PURPOSE
Reviews.Author: comanche
Reviews.Content: I understand the war of review about this camera, lot of people saying , there are fake review, i dont even want to go there , im just here to say i bought this camera, for basic stuff, not to get HD resolution, the set up looked very complicated but i was able to get it to work very fast, i believe i got lucky because i thought if i get stuck i wont be able to fix this network thing, the best feature for me and it works is the access thru my android phone, and its true what other reviews say, the audio and microphone only works with Internet Explorer, because it uses ActiveX, so dont even try making it work with google chrome , overall im pleased with the camera, i set it up wireless, signal is been stable so far , thanks

Reviews.Title: HooToo HT-IP210F Wireless Camera
Reviews.Author: Yee-Haa
Reviews.Content: These are decent wireless cameras. Can be tricky to set up if you are unfamiliar. I was unfamiliar but did get it. I now have two and have the iPhone app so I can watch the house while I'm away. They are designed for indoor use but I have them on the covered porch and they work fine. Remote pan and tilt, inexpensive, easy to mount, small size. Could have given a 4th star but the instructions are rather assuming.

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good
Reviews.Author: Doug Boreland
Reviews.Content: I have several Foscam 8910W's, and this camera is very similar, in all respects.  Haven't had much time with it yet, but so far I can recommend this item.  Something that STILL does not work properly is the application that is supposed to tell you the address of the camera.  No matter what, it would not see it.  So - being that I am technically inclined I just logged into the router to view attached clients, and from there got the address.  That problem also exists with the Foscam's in my experience.  This is my second HooToo device (first was TM-01, which I'm very impressed with).  Lastly, great customer support from HooToo  :)

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Phantom "WDC"
Reviews.Content: Nice camera suited for it's price.  The camera's night vision and motion cesors really works good. You can also view your camera thru your smart phone anywhere you are in the world. You can move, listen, and even speak using the camera. I would really recommend this IP camera. I gave 4 stars because it doesnt have much instruction in english but check it out in youtube.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Nathan T
Reviews.Content: I had heard a bunch of bad stuff about the Foscam IP cameras, so I wanted to give the HooToo a try. I'm very pleased I did because it is working fine. Other than the mediocre documentation that comes with it, the hardware seems great. All the motor functions work well and the picture seems fine too. I personally was trying to embed the stream to a website and I was able to do it fine with some 3rd party software.

Reviews.Title: Easy to set up
Reviews.Author: rilera
Reviews.Content: I am quite pleased with this camera, it's ease of setup and of use. It took less than 30 minutes to set up, including the wireless setup. The picture is good, even at night. I will use mine to monitor my home's security and my pets when I am away. This was a great deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: Works, sort of
Reviews.Author: Seth T Evans "Willis"
Reviews.Content: I received this as a gift for christmas. It worked at first, but then it wouldn't pan left/right. I reset it and it would sometimes pan, and then it stopped panning at all. Everything else worked; video, motion sensing, alarms, tilt...I tried using windows to control it, iPad, iPhone, and they all had the same results; no panning. I returned it and got a Foscam instead. Oh well.

Reviews.Title: Great Value, Easy to Set Up
Reviews.Author: Erin
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a basic wireless IP camera this is perfect. I bought this as a gift for my mom so she could watch for deliveries from her iPad. I was able to set this camera up on my first try (and I am not terribly tech-savvy). The software included with the camera did not work on my mac, but I was able to download an IP scanner for mac that worked just fine.The camera was also easy to link to my mom's iPad. The pan/tilt feature works wonderfully and both the daytime and night vision features are clear. I am very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Had issues installing with a Uverse router, here is my solution
Reviews.Author: am
Reviews.Content: I've set up our wireless internet at home, have wireless printer, laptops, ebooks, ipad and iphones all working and I do all the computer related problem resolution at home--but I couldn't get this camera to work in the wireless mode initially.  I'm using firefox to avoid issues with active x issues of IE and used an older laptop to avoid Windows 8 issues that might occur on my newest laptop.  Turned off Norton 360.  Though I get the camera to work with ethernet, the next part of installation hadn't worked in 20 tries.Update: After giving up on the camera, I found the solution while having a similar problem installing chromecast.  It's the Uverse router, not the camera, that is the issue. After at least 6 calls to Uverse I insisted they send out a technician.  He confirmed what I had found, the security access code to change the router settings didn't match the router at all.  After the equipment was changed, I called HooToo support and he was able to assist me in changing the router settings.  The cameras work perfectly now.  The quality of the views I can see on my PC while traveling are excellent.I would give the product 5 stars if it weren't for the difficulty editing router firewall settings.  But, as another poster has noted, if you call for support, you will receive excellent service.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product, difficult set up for external use
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: Bought it with Amazon prime, came home in 2 days, no problem. Quick and easy set up. All accessories are included for easy mounting the camera anywhere on the wall ceiling, etc. Came with everything you need. Wireless Wi-Fi works like a charm.However,I bought it to use to check up on my dogs while I am away from home. The DDNS set up was painful because of my router (Arris DG860 with twc) is not covered in the manual. I called support and they are very responsive and are willing to help. They were unable to help me, however my cousin does internet network for a living so he got it working.Now I can access and control the camera from my phone when I am traveling. I downloaded and am now using ip camera viewer app on the android.Thanks for an excellent product.

Reviews.Title: Took me some time to setup. Other than that no complaints
Reviews.Author: daniel turner
Reviews.Content: I feel like I am pretty tech savvy but it took me a while to get this setup for off-network use. What threw me off is when you forward the ports properly you still can't access the video feed via the external link on your own home network. You have to be on another network. Let me be clear, you CAN access the camera and control it on your internal network easily with the installed software, but to access the "worldwide" link per se, you have to be on an outside network. It took me a while to figure that out. Maybe there is a way around it but that's as far as I got. Other than that, the picture quality just mediocre, not nearly as good as the video posted by the company (which I find strange). I am not too worried about it because if you're using your cell phone to view the camera feed you can rack up data REAL fast even with the lower quality video. I am using this camera to keep an eye on my expensive saltwater coral reef aquarium. I go out of town more than average so I get nervous leaving a mega dollar sensitive eco system without supervision. At least if something happened I could call someone. Well worth the $55!

Reviews.Title: Review from a geek?
Reviews.Author: Antoine J. Bruguier "Tony"
Reviews.Content: This camera comes with a Windows software, but I didn't use it and tried to set it up myself:* I plugged it into my router with an ethernet cable. I could access it from Chrome from both Windows and Ubuntoo without any Java/flash, etc.. I just browsed to its IP on port 80.* I was able to setup the WiFi and it accepted WPA2/AES without any issue.* On my router, I setup a static LAN IP and port forwarding. The camera comes with a preset DDNS, but has a field for third party DDNS. I didn't use the third party DDNS, because the one provided by the camera worked already without any setup. Tried from an outside IP and it worked.* I setup the camera to email me pictures every time it detects some motion. It accepted Gmail's SMTP server because it has support for TLS. I didn't try the FTP upload, since email was sufficient for me.Additional features:* You can change the orientation from your browser* Multiple logins* Multiple email addressesI will see how the camera works over time and whether its motion detection works well. But so far, I'm very happy.If you are technically inclined, it should make you happy. If you are not technically inclined, read other reviews.

Reviews.Title: Decent for the cost
Reviews.Author: apharc
Reviews.Content: For the money, it may be worth it. The resolution is decent. As with most cameras in this price range, you need a bright light source for the best image. Don't expect to get a crisp image at night in the dark. Very rapid movements are not noticeable with this camera. It is a good camera to check on a house while away or to monitor a baby. The PTZ function works great, and I like to be able to move the camera to view different angles. Just as a heads up, don't expect it to be a fantastic security camera. Other more expensive versions are offered by HooToo for those purposes. So, depending on application, I recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The product works great.  The only issues I see is the web based control does not match the manual.  The manual shows that you can record video but have not been able to accomplish that.  Also I am not able to set up email alerts with my Gmail as of yet but sent an email to Support.  The cam itself is easy to set up.  It works well and is very inexpensive for all the features.  The night vision is excellent and it pretty much can see everything in all angles.  The android software is a little clunky but very functional.Delivery was fast and the product is very solid!

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: E. Battenberg "E"
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a piece of crap for $50.  I got something that works pretty well.  It was easy to setup.  Just plugged it in via ethernet to my router, found the newly assigned IP address in my router config, and logged in via web browser.  Connected it to my wifi network via the browser interface, and it's good to go.  The instructions are pretty poor (bad English translations), but for the tech savvy, it should be quite a breeze.The web interface isn't super polished but it gets the job done.  There are a few adequate free iOS apps for accessing and controlling the camera as well.  The number of features that $50 buys you was a nice surprise.

Reviews.Title: Once they're running, they run great.  If setup is beyond your skills, find someone to help. They're worth it!
Reviews.Author: Steve Kranyec
Reviews.Content: I own a small business and we purchased four of these cameras to help improve our monitoring capabilities.We followed the instructions and had the camera running on the local network in no time.  I have above average computer skills, but I believe that this step can be accomplished quickly by someone with minimal computer skills.When I tried to get the camera to be accessible via the internet, it was another story.  We have a slight complication in our network (we use our own wifi router rather than the one from the ISP) and I was unable to make it work.  I struggled on and off for a couple days and ended up calling in some professional help.We were charged $140 to get the cameras up and running, viewable through the internet. Most of the settings involved were in the routers, not in the cameras.Now that we're up and running, these cameras are an amazing value for the price. I can check on the office from my phone at any time.  Picture quality is acceptable (exceeded expectations for the price). Night mode is likewise acceptable.  You're not going to use these cameras to create youtube videos, but they're great for security.Unfortunately the fourth camera we tried to set up had a dead power supply. We contacted Hootoo and heard back within hours. They were able to quickly verify our purchase and send out a replacement power supply. Jay with Hootoo customer service was very helpful.Overall extremely pleased with these cameras. We'll be looking at the outdoor models next!

Reviews.Title: Baby Cam for non techies
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a baby monitor and it gets the job done. The audio lets me know when my baby needs me. The body of the camera is nice and rounded and not scary looking which is a plus. Good purchase and I would recommend this to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Purchase for Small Business Security - A+ customer service also.
Reviews.Author: Charles H. Witte
Reviews.Content: Ordered this camera for security at a business.  Wired and wireless setup was extremely intuitive.  Awesome functionality and clarity.  Haven't seen its potential in low light as our office is lighted 24 hours.  Setting up the internet access was beyond my limited IT scope, so I had to call customer support.  They were prompt, courteous and had me up and running in no time - even helped me set up email alerts.  I will be getting more of these handy little cameras very soon!!Addendum:  12-9-13: Since the original purchase i ordered 2 more of the same model.  Adding the cameras and viewing multi-cam is awesome and very easy to set up. IR image is very clear and bright. Cameras are very responsive.

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC!
Reviews.Author: ipadFan
Reviews.Content: Don't buy baby monitors ever again! Get a few of these! for the same cost as one video baby monitor, AND with more features and capabilities!!FANTASTIC camera, especially for the price. I bought two, and they worked great - DON'T EVER BUY A VIDEO BABY MONITOR AGAIN - for the cost of two of these, I had 2 way audio, moving video surveillance, night vision . . .the whole nine yards!! Get two of these, hook them up to your wi-fi (might take a little bit for that part), and you are good to go. FANTASTIC.UPDATE: One of the cameras started having power issues. I contacted the company, and it was within the warranty. I provided a receipt, and the serial of the non-working camera, and another is already on its way to my house. I will definitely be working with this company again. This is what service should look like!!

Reviews.Title: works great, highly recommended
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: I received this IP camera a couple of weeks ago and installed it in my living room.  For indoor purposes,  it works great.  The setup and installation was easy, thanks to my brother.  I can use my cell phone to monitor my camera when I am out of the house,  and I also receive notification e-mails when it senses any movement when I'm away.  The IP camera was very affordable and well worth the money.  Highly recommended for anyone who needs an affordable option for home surveillance.

Reviews.Title: Works beyond my expectation.
Reviews.Author: Leon King
Reviews.Content: This camera works great. It's easy to set up. Everything is intuitive and the instructions are easy to follow. In about 20 minutes, it already started working. It can point to almost any direction and have a nice motion detection function. The wireless connection means I can place it anywhere in the house and still be able to control the direction of the camera using the button on the screen. The night vision function is very useful.Since it has it's own light source, everything looks clear even in total darkness. I like the mobile phone access to the camera even more. Now I can check  what's going on at home when I'm at work. I plan to buy a few more of this and have a full coverage of the house. I will highly recommend this cute camera to my friends.

Reviews.Title: A Cool IP camera with powerful functions yet easy to setup
Reviews.Author: overdrunk
Reviews.Content: My wife bought this IP camera because my friend bought the same camera and told us it was fantastic. Actually his camera helped him from a breaking in and burglary because the camera sent him pictures when it detected something wrong. He called police, and the thief was caught on the scene, and he was at work. So we also decided to buy this camera. It is very cool. It has video and audio. Infrared function makes it more attractive since you can watch you living room and you door at night. But I love it most because I can watch my daughter and son play when I am working in the company.

Reviews.Title: good camera worth money
Reviews.Author: Q. X.
Reviews.Content: The camera is very good given the price. The motion detection is excellent for monitoring, and pan/tilt function is fancy. There are cheaper choices but cannot meet such high quality. The installation is a little tricky for non-IT guys, but there should be no problem if following the instructions carefully.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: M. Ma
Reviews.Content: I used panasonic IP camera before, this one definitely beat it. From it, you really can see the technology has been improved so much and so fast. I never expect a little IP camera can do motion detection. That's a very fancy feature to me. In terms of the price, I am very happy with it. Now, I can say "good bye" to my little boy when I work over time. Recommend it highly!

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Xiaodong Li
Reviews.Content: The functions work very nicely, actually beyond my expectation, given the price. Motion detection, night vision, email alert are all nice designs.

Reviews.Title: Great Product with minor flaws
Reviews.Author: Andrew W
Reviews.Content: I was given this item for free in return for writing this review. I must say the camera works great with some minor flaws. The infared works very well in the dark and the picture quality is good for the resolution it displays (640x480). The rotation spectrum on this camera is amazing and it can be moved in almost all directions. The directions may be overwhelming which is why a quick installation guide is also included making it very simple to setup. I have previously set up a few wireless security cameras so the process was not new to me but the instructions were much clearer than other products. The product comes with a manufacturer DDNS address so you can access the device when you are not at home which is a major plus. the quality of the camera is nice and the camera interface is simple yet elegant. The few flaws with the product include a terrible old looking installation software as well as an installation disc which includes all their camera products. A specific disc for this model should be included to make it more simple than a general disc.The product also has slots for an SD card and Sim card however this model does not support either which can be deceiving. The camera comes with all  supplies needed to mount the device as well. Also be sure to shut off the continuous blinking red led light in the settings once it is set up since it can be extremely annoying.

Reviews.Title: It does the job I need it to do -- Quite well in fact.
Reviews.Author: fezzik
Reviews.Content: Wanted a Camera in my basement to be able to monitor the play of our children without having to stay in the basement with them.Pro:- pans and tilts- price- install (for me) was easy and straightforward- IR for night/dark viewing- 15 configuration presets for locations.  So click a button and the camera will adjust the pan/tilt to the configured location- responsiveness using ethernet is very good.  Not used just the wireless interface, being in the basement, hardwired would just provide better access than wifi.- resolution is respectable.  More expensive camera might provide better, but the detail is fine for monitoring a room.- Color representation is very good to my eye.  Watching youtube video's on other camera, the colors can be off by alot, this seems true to life for my untrained eye.Cons:- would like a wider viewing angle on the lens.  Granted the camera pans/tilt but would still prefer a wider viewing angle- in a very quite room, the movement of the camera could be heard. But with standard room/tv noise it is not likely to be noticed- the monitoring software does the job, but its not A+ grade software. the pan/tilt works fine from the PC, but the web insterface from an android device, doesn't work well. Havent tried 3rd party apps to control it yet.believe that there is a speaker and/or mic capability.  I dont have a mic handy to try it out.  Cannot comment on that ability.  Because of where I placed the camera, I placed a block of wood under the rear of camera to angle it down more.  This is for monitor kids on the ground playing.  With camera on top of a bookshelf, with camera flat, it didnt pan down far enough.  Didnt want to mount to the ceiling or anything so this worked for me.Willing to answer any questions on this.  Or can provide more details if needed.  For the price, its serves the need.  There might be more expensive or more feature laden cameras, but for a install it/forget it/access when needed camera.  Works great.Why not 5 stars?  Nothing is perfect.  Better web/control interface would be nice.  Higher resolution would be nice.

Reviews.Title: Works well but hard to set up
Reviews.Author: Bismuth
Reviews.Content: Somehow the detailed instructions were just rather confusing.  There were two or three times when I thought about sending the camera back as "defective" but each time I was ready to give up I sorted out how to do one more thing to get it to work.  Honestly it does work pretty well now and I have accessed it via my local router and also via the internet using the ip hosting website which is provided free.  I have an app on my ipad and also one on my android phone and I can use a browser on the PC to access this camera.  Image is pretty good and IR intensity for night use is better than I expected.So the big negative it that this was a bit hard to set up, between the instructions and the built-in user interface in the camera, it took days and quite a bit of patience on my part.  This was the first IP camera I've set up and if I do it again I think it will go quicker.Sound using the built in mic and speaker are working now with the app on my android phone (cost $2.99 to buy the pro version) and also on the PC using IE.  I didn't like having to reduce the security settings on IE to get the sound to work so I don't think I will keep that set up.  Anyway, on the android phone the Mic seems quite sensitive but the volume coming out of the speaker in the camera is quite low.  Still tinkering with this.Another unexpected problem, I set this up in the garage while I was testing it and it interfered with our remote controlled garage door opener.  In fact, it pretty much completely jammed this.Another issue is that sometimes the camera seems to go offline all by itself, and sometimes after being unplugged for a while it will not come back online when plugged in.  This might be due to the strength of our wifi signal (or maybe the garage door controller is interfering with it too?)Overall a good deal for the price but this is not a "plug and play" item. Expect to take some time to set it up.

Reviews.Title: It WORKS!!!!
Reviews.Author: Aris Purwadi
Reviews.Content: It's tricky to get to understand the manual but google it and they have the video of how to make it work. Price is really good deal and it works. I set it up with my email for the camera.....my oh my I got bombarded with the pictures in my inbox.....COOL

Reviews.Title: Smooth install
Reviews.Author: Allison
Reviews.Content: My technical knowledge is rather basic and I was able to setup this camera in a little over 30 minutes. I would equate the technical knowledge to setting wireless internet at your house. If you can do that, then this camera should be easy. I like that the design is really simply and not too flamboyant unlike some of the other cameras out there, so it blends in the living room without attracting too much attention. If you are a total soccer mom and know nothing about computers, I would suggest looking at some youtube videos or calling their support, which from the other comments here seem to be pretty friendly to work with.

Reviews.Title: Great deal
Reviews.Author: Nadeem
Reviews.Content: The camera was not too hard to setup, but if you're not a techy you may not have the patience for this.I connected mine via wiFi can can monitor remotely via my smart phone.  There is a slight delay, but that is not bad considering it is on WiFi and I am on 3G most of the time and only 4G sometimes.I have not yet gotten the alarm to sound on detect.The night vision works great!

Reviews.Title: Great value for the price!
Reviews.Author: Ning Li
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because of the features this camera provided at a lower cost compared to the alternative brands. When comparing apples to apples, the value of this camera is hard to beat. Setup wasn’t terribly tough if you have a networking background, but it is a factor to consider when purchasing any ip camera.

Reviews.Title: Great price, decent picture, no audio, crummy!
Reviews.Author: Birdie
Reviews.Content: Bought this because we couldn't afford a $400 video baby monitor.  Installation was kind of a pain and took a while (I do have a slow computer) and you have to have their program downloaded on your computer; picture is great day and night (when it actually works and considering the price); audio doesn't work - never has.  Got it set up for the first time and everything was ok for about a week (minus the fact that audio didn't work), then the picture became intermittent, sometimes you can see it on your iPhone/iPad/etc sometimes you can't (for no apparent reason). And I have never been able to get it to work when I'm away from home and connected to a different network.  Now, it's not working at all.I have been talking with the company (phone and e-mail) since we purchased in June and this thing just refuses to work consistently.  Even the guys at HooToo, who are VERY helpful, patient, and kind, don't know why it's not working.Please see comment below on update (Added 2 stars for the customer service and support).  Fabulous company, would purchase another HooToo product in the future.

Reviews.Title: Great camera features, fantastic customer service
Reviews.Author: johnnyace
Reviews.Content: In addition to its great features and reasonable price, what really sets this camera apart is HooToo's excellent customer service and support.This camera worked flawlessly out of the box for me. Setup is straightforward and presented no problems (there are detailed instructions for the uninitiated at HooToo's website), and the video is accessible using a wide range of devices either on the LAN or across the internet.The firmware has a functional web interface regardless of browser (although some built-in recording features require ActiveX and thus Internet Explorer), however it's also compatible with most third party IP camera software so you can create as complex a monitoring system as you desire on any platform.Some features worth noting: daytime images are color correct due to the infrared filter, the conspicuously bright power LED can be disabled, the pan/tilt motors are quick and whisper quiet, the external mic and speaker connections can increase communication fidelity, and an internal relay switch can be remotely toggled to control other devices (for example a garage door).Finally, kudos for HooToo's excellent customer service. My first camera's infrared night vision failed while under warranty, and after just one email explaining the problem, HooToo offered to ship a replacement at no cost to me. That kind of support sparks pretty strong loyalty in this satisfied customer.

Reviews.Title: geat!
Reviews.Author: Tommy Tse
Reviews.Content: I use this camera strictly to monitor my living room while I am at work. It's easy to setup, and ability to have it snap pics on motion detect is awesome. The picture quality turned out to be a lot better than I expected, and surprising better than 4 camera dvr set that costs $500.

Reviews.Title: HooToo Wired/Wireless IP Camera (HT-IP210F) Review!
Reviews.Author: GeekHelpingHand "Louis Smith"
Reviews.Content: Keep your family safe by purchasing this product via Amazon US for about $70 and via Newegg.com for about $70 in white or block. And special thanks to our friends at HooToo for sending this out to review.Before I get to the product itself, I want to talk about what's inside the box. You will receive the product itself, a Quick Start Guide, a Setup CD, an ethernet cable, a stand, and an AC adapter. Taking a look at the product from the front you will see your camera in the center, a ring of LEDs, HooToo logo, and your indicator light inside the middle of your LEDs.Moving to the back of the product, you will see an ethernet port, SD card slot, I/O Alarm, antenna screw, SIM card slot, and ports for your audio, microphone, and DC. I find that installing the software, setting up the product, and using the product was super easy. I will have a how-to guide on our YouTube Channel and website.The web interface is very simple and easy to navigate. You can set up the camera in every possible way with no expertise needed whatsoever. I had no giant problems with this product besides that it would take a while to setup if you don't follow the directions correctly.At the end, it's a perfect product for small homes, multiple cameras, and a combination.

Reviews.Title: Great video quality
Reviews.Author: dsm_dfw
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a video camera to monitor my baby.  This product was very easy to setup, and the most important part, the video monitoring, worked excellent. The quality of the image is very clear.  I also liked the fact that I was able to monitor on my iphone and my ipad.  I would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value for the Money
Reviews.Author: Drew "DM"
Reviews.Content: I'm going to preface this by saying I was not given the camera so I could review it, I did not call tech support so I was not influenced by them to write this, and I am a computer person so I am comfortable with all the settings in my router and the camera.I was very impressed with this camera, even though the box it came in was marked with huge "Made in China" letters.  I have a medialink router, and it worked just as expected with it.  The initial software worked with both Windows 7 and Windows 8.  I did have some problems with the Active X control because I did not want to open it up for permissions as they state in the documentation, so I decided for now not to run it with a microphone or speakers.  But the browser-based software seems to run fine under Chrome and FIrefox so I am satisfied with it.  I was able to get the product set up on my internal wireless in less than one hour.  Getting it to work from the Internet takes longer and is more dependent on your router than the camera, so I'm not going into that here.  Let me say though that the camera works fine over the Internet.The picture quality is better than I expected, and it works great both during the day and night.  I am especially impressed by the night vision quality.  Pan and tilt work great, and you can set it to "patrol" either horizontal or vertical.  I am still experimenting with alarms, but I think I have it set up so it will send me an email with an attached image if the camera detects motion.  I had to use my Google account to set up the automated mailing, but that was all free.  Date and time were synced up using a ntp server so I didn't have to do anything there.  All the software for control comes with the camera so I didn't have to buy anything for it.  I got only one camera, so I don't know how it will work with more than that.There were many things I could ding on this, but I did not try a firmware or software upgrade yet, and I was impressed enough otherwise that I am still giving a five-star rating.  First, it seems that passwords are limited to 12 characters and it will chop off the last few characters silently, very annoying.  Second, I would have preferred that security be improved on the admin account login credentials by default, especially after the articles about the recent baby monitor hijacking.  Third, I would have liked a zoom but the focus is good by default and I can change the resolution so I am OK with it as-is.Overall I am very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: This is an impressive surveillance camera at a reasonable price ...
Reviews.Author: D. Fowler
Reviews.Content: One thing that you need to keep in mind is that most of these security / baby monitors are not intuitive to set up.  If you find yourself a bit tech-challenged, it might be wise to have someone on hand to be able to help you with this camera even before you order it.  Even an IT can end up being a bit flustered with installation, although the HooToo was not one of them.  The Quick Installation Guide for the HT-Ip210F will get you started, but the manufacturer's websibe has more information to help guide you if you are going at it alone.With a quick five step process you can access the HooToo from you local network.  There are visuals in the installation guide that will enable you to be up and running quickly, including a visual that shows you what you should be seeing once you're configured properly.  Accessing from the Internet is where many people will have more difficulty.  I'd recommend heading to the recommended HooToo downloads and, if necessary, emailing support.  Things like configuring your router can be tricky, so if you can receive help for this from a friend, you'd do well to accept it.At this price point, I'm definitely impressed with the HooHoo's capabilities and what I'm seeing.  Many of the baby monitors I'm seeing out there and have used are quite a bit more expensive and this one is a bargain in comparison.  I've used several of them and one of the best features, the pan and tilt, comes at a cost in baby monitors.  There are several uses for these cameras and in fact, I have one relative who uses these as a chicken cam to make sure there are no predators lurking in the coop (I kid you not).  If you want a versatile, multi-faceted/use pan and tilt camera, I'd recommend trying out the HooToo.WHAT's IN THE BOX:-1 x Camera-1 x Antenna-1 x Adapter-1 x Network Cable-1 x Manual-1 x CD-ScrewsSPECIFICATIONS:Model:  HT-Ip210F (IR Filter)IMAGE SENSOR:Image Sensor:  1/4" CMOS SensorDisplay Resolution:  640 x 480 Pixels (300,000 Pixels)Lens:  F:3.6mm, F:2.0, Built-in IR FilterMinimum Lux Required:  0.5lm for Normal OperationLENS:Lens Type:  Glass LensViewing Angle: 90°AUDIO:Input:  Built-in Microphone / One Channel Audio InputOutput:  One Channel Audio OutputAudio Compression:  ADPCMVIDEO:Image Compression:  MJPEG FormatImage Frame Rate:  30fps (VGA). 30fps (QVGA)Resolution:  640 x 480 (VGA), 320 x 240 (QVGA)Flip Mirror Images:  Vertical / HorizontalFrequency:  50Hz, 60Hz, OutdoorVideo Parameters:  Brightness, Saturation, Contrast, HueCOMMUNICATION:Ethernet Interface:  Built-in 10/100 Mbps, Auto MDI/MDIX, RJ-45Supported Protocol:  TCP/IP, HTTP, DNS, DHCP, PPPoE, SMTP, FTP, SSL, TFTP, NTP, NTP, ARP/RARP, NFS, RTSP, RTP, RTCPWireless Standard:  IEEE 802.11b/g/nData Rate:  802.11b:  11Mbps (Max.), 802.11g:  54Mbps (Max.)  802.11n:  150Mbps (Max.)Wireless Security:  WEP & WPA WPA2 EncryptionPHYSICAL:Pan/Tilt Angle:  Pan 320°, Tilt 120°Alarm Input:  One Channel On/Off InputAlarm Output:  One Channel On/Off Relay OutputInfrared Lights:  Built-in LED Illuminators for Night Vision up to 20mPOWER:Power Supply:  Dc5V/2.0APower Consumption:  7 Watts (Max.)ENVIRONMENT:Operating Temperature:  0°C - 55°C (32°F - 131°F)Operating Humidity:  20° - 85° (Non-condensing)Storage Temperature:  -10°C - 60°C (-14°F - 140°)Storage Humidity:  0° - 90° (Non-condensing)PC REQUIREMENTS:CPU:  2.0GHZ or above (Suggested 3.0 GHZ)Memory:  256MB or Above (Suggested 1.0GB)Display Card:  64M or AboveSupported OS:  Microsoft Windows 2000/XP/Vista 7/Apple/MacWARRANTY:1 YearSample provided for review.

Reviews.Title: Somewhat complex to set up, but good functionality
Reviews.Author: Comdet
Reviews.Content: I want to preface my review with the statement that this is the first IP camera I ever set up. So, some of my initial struggles could very well be due to my lack of experience with router configuration and DDNS service.The overall build quality of the camera seems pretty good. The plastic housing seems sturdy and the overall design is attractive (at least, attractive as far as IP cameras go).The included instructions are both terse and poor. It didn't give me the warm fuzzies about the installation process from the get-go. But, a more complete, and pretty well-done manual is available on the HooToo site. I would strongly encourage IP camera neophytes to go there and get the manual before starting the install.The actual installation process became more clear once I got into it. I had a hiccup getting the software installed on my PC (Win 7 32 bit) in that it hung up during the install requiring a reboot. This may have been due to my anti-virus software (Avast) which I forgot to suspend, as recommended in the install instructions. Attempt #2 with Avast suspended went through to completion.The actual functionality of the camera is pretty good. Decent video that is clear. Granted, it is a low-end camera so don't expect to see images in HD, but the resolution was more than acceptable.What was less than decent was the wi-fi range. It was fine in the same room, but trying to go further proved problematic at best. That's not a concern for me since my preferred camera location makes it easy to hard wire it to the router, but if you're planning on using this in a wireless configuration be prepared for potential range challenges.Overall video performance at this price point merits five stars. I'll knock it down one star due to WiFi issues. I won't take any stars away due to installation challenges since experienced users may not need as much hand-holding as I did, but if you are a novice, set aside a good chunk of time to get this up and running.[Sample provided for review]

Reviews.Title: Remote controlled pan and tilt home security camera
Reviews.Author: Nuknuk
Reviews.Content: This camera can do almost anything.  It has motion detection, wired or wireless, night vision, email notification, app enabled, access through a regular browser, two way audio for communication, and you can physically tilt and pan the camera through your remote location. Indoor only.Installation:First, you would need to directly connect the camera via an ethernet cable to your router to set it up.  After setup, you can transfer the camera anywhere in the house without the cable - now you are wireless.  The camera came with an installation CD, wall/ceiling mount with screws, ethernet cable, AC power adapter and a brief instruction manual.  I first tried to set it up myself.  The camera can be setup up either with Windows or  Mac OS.  Although  I have an iMac with Windows Home Premium and Mountain Lion using VMWare, tech support recommended to use the Windows version as an easier alternative.  I installed the CD and an App through HooToo's website but either way it could not detect any camera through my network.  That was when I contacted HooToo customer service.To make a long story short, my Ooma telephone which is directly connected to my modem became the main issue.  My internet goes trough Ooma first before going to my Apple Extreme router.  It would be easier if the router is directly connected to the modem instead. At first, my main suspect was the Apple 802.11ac router because it came out just a couple of months ago - I was thinking of compatibility issue.  Raymond, the tech support person, was able to make a quick fix (by the way, this guy really knows what he is doing). Now I can connect to the camera at home through a remote PC or my phone.Phone App:For the smartphone app, CamViewer for IP Webcams by John McKerrell, a free app (2.99$ if you want to add audio functionality) is great. I can talk to my kids while at work using my phone.  One way audio was very clear. You can hear everything that is happening in the room.  Two-way audio has some feedback interference, but I can still communicate with my kids.You can adjust the resolution up to 640 x 480 via remote location.  You can snap pictures and also pan and tilt around the room with the camera's built-in motor. Overall, this is a nice home security camera that doesn't cost a lot with lots of features.Cons:- setup can be a snap or complex depending on your setup.  I got into a snag because of my Ooma.A sample of this product was sent to me for review purposes.

Reviews.Title: Installation is hard, but once it's up & running, it's good
Reviews.Author: Yarii
Reviews.Content: I certainly don't consider myself technically challenged, but I needed help getting this camera set up. Thankfully a friend of mine understands Internet-Protocol Cameras, and he helped. Also, Hootoo's web site has complete instructions for downloading, much more than what's included with the camera. Instructions that come in the box - there isn't much, it's too tiny to read and hard to understand. Or you can email Hootoo's customer service and someone from there will call you back at a time convenient for you. Their tech support is outstanding.Make SURE to reset the log-in for this camera and also that you have a very strong password for your router; you don't want hackers taking over your camera like what's been reported on the news recently.The IQ of this camera is good considering the price; and the night vision is even better than my Logitech Alert night vision camera, which cost 4 times what this Hootoo costs. A camera was provided for my unbiased review.

Reviews.Title: Hootoo camera
Reviews.Author: Jeannette H
Reviews.Content: At first I had a hard time setting up this camera because I had a Mac instead of Windows. Raymond from customer tech support was so helpful and amazing. He set up everything for me! I love this camera so far. I can view it from my iPhone, laptop or just about anywhere!

Reviews.Title: Hootoo camera as monitor
Reviews.Author: Kmiars
Reviews.Content: It was somewhat difficult to set up the camera for use with an iPhone, but Hootoo customer service was great and set it all up for us over the phone.

Reviews.Title: Good Product and excellence support
Reviews.Author: Chun Yin Siu
Reviews.Content: Pro:Had it for 6 months. Work perfectly. Never drop a wireless connection and you can easily find free iphone apps support itCons:Can't get sound working, but I can't complain for its price.DDNS is not always working, but i run blueIris at home, so it doesn't really matter to meI have another hootoo camera (HT-IP212) which loss wireless connection after 3 months.I emailed them, they replied me on the same day. After troubleshoot it for few days. they offered me a free replacement.Hootoo may not be a top tier brand, but for its price, features and support and i can find workaround for their cons (sound, DDNS), I will buy from them next time

Reviews.Title: Impressed customer service and product
Reviews.Author: Attinder S Khalsa
