Reviews.Content: I bought few camera's almost year back. They are working fine, with exception that one of them started hanging. I contacted hootoo customer service and they sent me replacement very quickly.I would recommend camera's from hootoo knowing that they got good support and go extra mile to make sure that product you bought works.

Reviews.Title: Hootoo HT-IP210F
Reviews.Author: Rico Ruiz Estrada
Reviews.Content: This is my first IP Camera and I am very pleased with it. The video quality is clear enough for what I use it for and the night vision is a plus. I was only able to do the minimal set-up and I have to say that everyone has raved about Raymond at technical support that I did not hesitate in calling for help. Indeed Raymond answered all my questions and was able to help me in an expeditious and professional manner. Will not hesitate to purchase another HOOTOO IP camera in the future and would highly recommend to others who are thinking about this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Iamwally
Reviews.Content: Received this camera a few days ago and I am pleasantly surprised by it's feature set and how well it functions.  I do have some observations that I might have liked to be a little better but overall I think it is more than worth its price tag.I would love to see a free mobile app that provides sound features.  Since this camera has 2 way audio it would have been nice to not have to purchase an app capable of that since it is a great feature.  That being said the app was only $2 or $3 so it wasn't too bad.I think the focus could be a little sharper but that is a lot to ask of a .3 megapixel camera and at this price point.The other thing that I would like to change, and this applies to all cameras of this type not just this one, is an easy way to extend the power supply wire.  These cameras work great wireless and so it would be nice to be able to extend the power supply because often they could and would be mounted some distance from an outlet.  Maybe instead of a fixed wire transformer it could come with a transformer with 2 screws for connecting to the wire then it would be easy to extend. Along with a power connection with 2 screws on the camera just like the i/o and alarm connections so you could run any wire for power without the barrel connector.  Just a thought.  :)The software which comes with the camera works well and is quite functional.Infrared night vision so far works quite well.Pan and tilt sometimes seems to stick a bit, not sure if that has to do with connection or actual device, will have to play around with it some more to figure that out.Also a bonus is that it comes with its own Dynamic DNS address which is quite convenient and saves some hassle and money.Overall I am very pleased with the camera and would suggest it to friends.

Reviews.Title: it works perfect.
Reviews.Author: mrghm
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my house surveillance ,it is so nice & working perfectly.installation was not so easy but it was OK for me  with using the booklet.

Reviews.Title: Hootoo delivers for the price!
Reviews.Author: peterb
Reviews.Content: There may be cameras with clearer pictures and with more features, however this Hootoo camera is an amazing value with wireless IP, pan, and tilt all for less than $70.I am reasonably competent technically and was able to set it up both wired and wireless for local viewing on my network, however, I just could not get the factory provided DDNS external web site to work.  I then set up another external DDNS web site through NO-IP.com, but couldn't get that to work either.Finally, I gave up and called the technical support number fearing the worst, particularly when the phone rang and rang forcing me to leave a voice mail.  Too my pleasant surprise, I received a call back from tech support gentleman named Raymond.  He was very knowledgeable and easy to work with.  I gave him access to my Vista laptop and he configured only a few settings, including correcting to use the proper ID at NO-IP - that may have been my mistake -- your login email for NO-IP account is not your account ID -- you will be able to confirm what you set up as account ID in your NO-IP account settings and then use that value in the DDNS box provided on Hootoo camera software.This was working great until I attempted to run camera over the internet (not local) on a Windows 7 laptop.  It seems the more recent versions of IE block the ability to install the software the camera needs.  I emailed Raymond in tech support once more and he walked through some IE configuration changes that were required for the later versions of IE.Again, I am reasonably competent, but sure there are individuals more technical that could research and figure this out themselves.  It was just comforting to know that Hootoo has good tech support, because they will likely save you time getting it all configured.I know this is an indoor camera, but I have it in a covered outdoor patio in my vacation home and love the fact I can see what things look like outside remotely.I don't think you can go wrong at this price and I give 5 stars for the tech support I received!

Reviews.Title: For the price it's great!
Reviews.Author: The real Amazon fan
Reviews.Content: I can save my pan/tilt settings on IP Camera Viewer app just like how I can with my other IP cameras in the house.  I've only had this unit for a few days, but so far it's been great.  The daytime image has nice saturation and clarity.  Night vision is pretty good too.  The built-in speaker and mic is adequate to listen in and or to make a few remarks.The reason why I tried this HooToo model was because I own a Foscam one similar to this model (8910w), but on the Foscam I could not save the pan/tilt settings on my app.  Also, I was not very happy with the audio performance of the 8910W...The HooToo works as expected ...and at a lower price.I hope to get a couple of years use out of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Vinnie
Reviews.Content: This camera for the money is excellent! U can record or just view live feed from iPhone or laptop just need to download free app! Has 8 diff settings to pre-set so u DONT have to maneuver the camera using arrows. Had no problem listening but audio does not work if you want to speak to a person. Worked out well considering I used it for new dog sitter while on vacation worked great! Very clear and even IT guy was impressed !

Reviews.Title: Good camera, great vendor
Reviews.Author: Cindy M
Reviews.Content: I have owned several brands of cameras with pretty much the same profile. The only negative is the camera still only supports wireless b/g. This reduces the range on wireless installations. I have purchased about 10 of the HT-IP210F cameras. All of the software features work. The microphone also works and provides clear sound. The cameras are installed in 4 locations: 2 in the US and 2 in Costa Rica. The cameras are all internet accessible. One of the cameras had a fuzzy picture and the vendor quickly sent me a replacement. I have started using the Apexis software that is available for free from HOOTOO.com. The software provides control and DVR functionality. I  recommend.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Mykool
Reviews.Content: I was unable to totally set up the camera by myself ( computer illiterate) but the customer support was the best I've had the pleasure to deal with in a long time. Can not ask for better support. The camera is a gem also!

Reviews.Title: HooToo Great customer service
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: I had a few problems setting up my camera so i called customer service number and my problems were fixed and the tech that helped me was very knowledgeable and understanding. I wish all customer care services were as good as them. wont hesitate to get products in the future for this company...Joe

Reviews.Title: Works exactly as expected
Reviews.Author: Mark R. Kluth
Reviews.Content: Works great, easy to set up and use. I like that it works in full light as well as total darkness without having to set anything.

Reviews.Title: Considereing price it's the best CAM available
Reviews.Author: GRW
Reviews.Content: Clear crisp and colorful image.There is no other cam available delivering that quality at that price tag.Features are awesome, too.Highly recommended.Hint:There are Apps (Tiny Cam) available streaming multiple cams at the same time, better than the provided software.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: HZ "Smart Buyer"
Reviews.Content: This is a good wireless IP camera.  It has many presets and vertical and horizontal spanning button features that allow me to quickly view what is going on from any computer.

Reviews.Title: Excellent IP camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Greenhill "Legman13"
Reviews.Content: I have researched for different IP-camera brands, and I chose Hootoo finally because the price with many good reviews. The package arrived within couple days in good condition and it worked very well after I finished the set up. The picture is excellent; especially at night, it is crystal clear with dim light.  Now I can monitor/record all activities by internet and receive the alarm with my smart phone. For the tablet I use "IP cam viewer" app and it works very well. My setting is little different from the user manual (suggest downloading a PDF version for your use) for Firefox or Google browsing and I do not need to install the Active X for multiple cameras:1. Install "IP camera"2. Install " IP camera finder"3. Install " IP camera tools"4. Install" IP camera Client"5. Open " IP camera finder" and use the wizard to detect the IP6. Open "IP camera tools" Please choose the second choice for Firefox or Google browsing to follow the pull down menu for the setting. Do not forget to name the alias such as"Camera 1" for the first camera and so on. Set the port starts with 80XX (8035, 8060  ...etc...) and each camera has to set to different port. The user ID and passwords can be the same for all the cameras. If you wish to receive the alarm from Google mail (computer or smart phone) you can ignore the MSN set up.7. Open" IP camera Client" click scan and add "Camera 1" and other cameras, and you are done.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Unhappy
Reviews.Content: Great camera with good features that was easy to install with a little help from the folks at SkyValley. Thanks Raymond.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera, Great Price
Reviews.Author: senorv47
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a reasonable Camera that I could use to monitor my two new Golden Retriever puppies while I was out and this camera was perfect for the price. I do suggest that there be a patch to make this compatible with 64 bit OS's and IE, but I sure they will at some point. So if you are looking for a good reasonable product, this is it.

Reviews.Title: Good Technology
Reviews.Author: ANTIPAINTER
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to use for baby monitor, it works for Mac users. Would recommend to friend. Good image quality and has two-way sound. Use IP Cam Viewer app for iPhone.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Heidi L Mefford
Reviews.Content: Easy to install emails come within 10 seconds of motion detection. Really accurate about a 3 sec delay on live feeds. Have one front of the house one in back. Install in the computer easy and ya don't have to leave the computer on the iPad iPhone apps are great and free.

Reviews.Title: Blown away !
Reviews.Author: Taylor
Reviews.Content: This ip210f camera was a breeze to setup. I really liked how the installation was fast and easy, and the entire setup was complete within half an hour without problems. The camera is integrated with web-based monitoring software with some pretty standard features including navigation, pan, tilt (with adjustable speeds), mirror & flip. Unlike some cheap DVRs, the image is clear with faces clearly identifiable. The color balance seems to be better than other IP cameras. Just note that the built-in IR LEDs do illuminate the surroundings after dark, and draws attention to the camera which can be a good or bad thing depending on what you need it for.Remote viewing from over the internet is simple, but I didn't use the ddns that comes with the camera. Instead, I assigned a static ip address to the camera (check with your IP address is static or dynamic), and then change the port number for the camera (default is 80, usually there is no need to change the port number. However in some cases the isp blocks port 80, so I change it to 8081 to accommodate it). I then went to the port forwarding setup page for my Belkin N750 router, enter the port numbers and the IP addresses of my ht-ip210f, and it's done. By entering in the full IP address followed by a colon and the port number used, I can now be sitting tight watching my house and knowing what's going on around.I'm impressed by this little camera and I would not hesitate to buy again.

Reviews.Title: I feel Safer already.
Reviews.Author: Louis Rogers
Reviews.Content: Hey this think is really great a I will order another one.  It does what I ordered it to do and I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: works well
Reviews.Author: bradeen
Reviews.Content: i would like if the sound went thu the inter net and not a new wire for it that i have buy

Reviews.Title: Great Bank for the Buck
Reviews.Author: dk
Reviews.Content: I had a 3 year old DVR system that recently took a crap on me. Rather than paying $300 to replace it the entire thing. I opted to purchase a Hootoo IP camera, and IMO it was an excellent choice.The biggest problem with DVRs is that if someone happens to break in your house, they can see camera/wires and steal the entire dvr unit leaving you with no footage. With an IP cam, you can set it to record snapshots / videos and have it sent directly to your email. This way, even if the thief steals the camera, you still have the footage and are not completely screwed.Pros- Easy to setup- No wires compared to a typical DVR system- Significantly cheaper- Pretty good pictureCons- InstructionsFor the price, this thing is a very good investment. I haven’t tried the other brands yet, but I am very happy with the Hootoo one.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: harryhondo
Reviews.Content: I LOVE the little unit! Really does the job I need it for. I do not, however, like the control interface. It was SO frustrating to set the camera to where I needed it. I pushed the "go right button" once and it panned the whole room! I kept saving positions so I could at least get close to try again...I finally got it.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: luqui
Reviews.Content: Let's start by saying that for $69.99 plus a little bit of time configuring the camera/router/internet settings you get A LOT OF PEACE OF MIND.This product is very good and the customer support answered my questions by e-mail in less than a day. I did not think that this was going to work but in a couple of hours I had it up and running and now my family from overseas can even have access to the live feed.Do not hesitate and buy it, it works great.I bought the second one two days after I installed the first one.Cons: sometimes it stops recording for no reason, I will need to do more research on its functions to see if I am doing something wrong.

Reviews.Title: Yes
Reviews.Author: 1cerberus
Reviews.Content: Very nice,and easy to use,Great for the price,Great Product great service,Would buy more if neededQuick service

Reviews.Title: Unless you're a computer geek, forget it!
Reviews.Author: RickD
Reviews.Content: The only thing I can get it to do is live video and sometimes not even that. The instructions are in Chin-English and pretty useless. Unless you have computer psychic abilities forget about using this. Last page of manual says if you have issues contact the seller first and then contact their tech support. And of course they don't give any contact information!

Reviews.Title: believe the one and two star reviews....
Reviews.Author: S. Guthrie "ideagirl"
Reviews.Content: Too hard for your average joe to set up.  If you are familiar with computers and security cameras, then maybe its a different story.  I have a couple of the ipex ping (?) cameras and the were simple to set up compared to this.  No ptz, but from review I just read, that functionality may only be used from 15 feet or so.  I don't know as I said, I could never even begin to figure out how to set it up...

Reviews.Title: Cool little camera
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for a baby cam and was a little nervous for the product since it was low cost. I did not read anywhere other than another review that this is accessible through an ipad and took a chance since the price was reasonable.  I really was hoping it would work with the ipad and it does!!! there are several apps that it works with both free and paid. the $0.99 cent one was best. So glad I got this now we can see all the funny stuff our boy does while in his crib.

Reviews.Title: Just an ordinary camera
Reviews.Author: Sir Roberto
Reviews.Content: If you're lying top-notch security I would recommend a picture that high as a better make it by Pictureview lying and also the night reading is clear this cameras meant for very very much watching a baby or watching a spare room nothing for real security evidence

Reviews.Title: Good camera for a good price, and excellent customer service.
Reviews.Author: Miguel Brun
Reviews.Content: I bought a different camera from Hootoo, the HT-IP210HD last year, but I was having problems with it freezing. They were quick to answer my emails and sent me different firmwares to try to fix the problem. Finally, one of those firmwares fixed my problem sometime ago, but now I needed to move the camera and the wireless didn't work, so what did Hootoo did? They sent me a brand new 210F camera since they don't make my model anymore. I am blown away by how responsive and helpful these guys have been.This 210F camera is working like it should. It has good picture quality, night vision, the microphone and speaker work fine over the phone, and it hasn't skipped a beat since installation. The one thing I would like it to have is a wider view angle, but since I can pan and tilt, no big deal.

Reviews.Title: Great Budget Indoor IP Camera! A Review for Fellow Beginners
Reviews.Author: HokiEE01

logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_moG9AMKFKQ6GS8currentClick) { return cv_moG9AMKFKQ6GS8currentClick(); } } } Length:: 6:31 MinsThe HooToo HT-IP210F Indoor Pan/Tilt Camera is awesome and the best feature about this camera is one you would never know - stellar customer support from HooToo. I was blown away with their incredibly friendly, helpful, USA based customer support team. HooToo had provided me a sample of this product in exchange for a fair and honest review on Amazon. I was a little leary about setting this guy up but knew it would be great if I could get it to work and HooToo's Customer Support Team reassured me that they could help me if I ran into any difficulty. I have Verizon Fios, a home Mac running OS X Mavericks and a Windows Laptop running Windows 7. I also have very little experience with the IT background that you will need to do this yourself but want to share my experience. If you want to see the highlights and my review of the camera go down to the PROs and CONs section.I unpacked the camera and didn't really know where to get started. Luckily, HooToo provided a Quick Installation Guide so that is where I started. First you plug in the included RJ-45 ethernet cable to your router and provide power to it. Next you take the CD that came with the camera and load it into your computer. I first put it into my Mac and was clueless and could not find the right file to get it going. I decided to give it a try in my Windows 7 laptop and had a lot better success with that - so that is my first tip - set this thing up in Windows if you can. Once you install and run the HooToo IP Camera Tool you should see your IP camera's IP address on your network. Double click on the IP address and you will go to that IP address on your web browser. You will be prompted for a username and password - put in admin and leave the password blank and log in. Here is tip number two - use Chrome. At first I used Internet Explorer 9 and had all sorts of issues with the ActiveX controls and getting it to work. I tricked out all of the settings and set my PC to the lowest security settings and finally got it to work. Once I found the Chrome workaround I went back and reset all of my IE values to their default values.You finally get to see the camera image, get to play around with the pan and tilt functions and get a sense of accomplishment. However, your sense of accomplishment will be short lived because you need to set this up to be a wireless camera. Have no fear, HooToo customer support is here. This is about as far as I could get on my own. I called HooToo and spoke to Raymond and he saved the day for me. After conversing a little bit, I decided it would be easier to download some software so he could hop onto my computer and get this camera set up. That was tip number three because this makes it incredibly easier to get across the finish line. I answered all of Raymond's questions and he just went to town on my computer. We got hung up because I had never logged into my router before. I called Verizon Fios customer support - eventually they had me hit the reset button on my router - here is the ironic part - I needed Internet Explorer to be able to re-enter my new password. I called Raymond back and he set me all up. I told him I wanted to set it up on my iPhone as well as be able to view it remotely. Raymond then proceeded to set up port forwarding on my router and walked me through the whole thing as he was doing it. Once I was all set up he cleared up my last issue, which was using Internet Explorer with the HooToo website. I couldn't get the wireless settings pop-out tabs to show and when I logged in using Chrome - you guessed it, it worked - tip number 4. So use Windows to install IP Camera Tool, use Chrome to view the image, use HooToo customer support if you get stuck and use Chrome to toggle the wireless settings on the HooToo web site.Yes, the camera and its features are important but so is the ease-of-use in setting it up for the novice.PROS*640x480 at 15 fps, 320x240 at 30 fps*Pans/Tilts*A great value as far as features versus cost*Night vision*Motion Detection - Can set up e-mail alerts and snap photos upon motion activation*Two-way audio - so you can talk back and forth*Very quiet panning and tilting - it does have a blinking red light, which some users will want but I turned it off from the HooToo web page*Comes with CD, mounting bracket and screws, Quick Installation Guide, User's Manual, RJ-45 cable, power adapter*50 Hz, 60 Hz, Outdoor modes*Optimized MJPEG video compression for transmission*Wifi 802.11 b/g*Outstanding customer support - Makes all the difference in the world for a novice setting one of these upCONs*Night vision is not as good as an outdoor camera*No zoom, but I knew this wasn't a Pan/Tilt/Zoom camera to start out with*Learning curve - make sure you have some time on your hands when you unpackaged this and go for it*Blinking red light but this can be turned on or off*Setup was pretty tricky for a novice. I had no idea where to go on the included CD on my Mac. I eventually used the Quick Installation Guide and Windows to get the IP Camera Tool program installed. HooToo can do a better job of walking the novice through this. They sent me some links on Youtube but here is what I think they should do. I think they should make the CD such that you select whether you are installing it on a Mac or Windows. From there, you watch a series of videos that show you how to get the camera installed. I think that will provide a lot of value for the user because it will make his or her life easier. I am talking about full videos from unpacking to port forwarding. I know that setup will be different on everyone's network but seeing someone else do it would build some confidence in the user. There could also be different videos for the different types of installs - all the way through from either a Mac or a Windows machine. I think they could do a better job with the Quick Start Guide as well, it could be bigger and include more explanations of what you are going to do and how you are going to do it. It needs to walk you through the process better.As far as Apps for your iPhone or Android phone, I found Surveillance Pro for Foscam (this is a generic IP camera and a lot of the Foscam Apps will work this camera just fine). I also found uFoscam: 2way Audio & AV Record worked pretty good as well - it can crash on IOS 7 although they are working to fix that.The best thing about this camera is the excellent value. You really get a lot of bang for your buck. The HooToo customer support team should alleviate any concerns that you might have about not getting this camera to work. Even though I was provided a sample for testing I would not hesitate to get another camera from them on my own because I know they would help get it to work for me. There are no real cons here really for me...People need to remember that a HD cam will also chew up a lot of bandwidth - 640 x 480 is plenty for me. If you are looking at getting this or a baby monitor, get this, it is a lot more flexible and when your baby gets older you can use it for lots of other things, like watching them play in the basement when you are upstairs. It also has the two way talk as well as the ability to be viewed remotely. So if you are going to spend the money you could spend half as much and get a whole lot more for your money.I was provided a sample by the manufacturer in exchange for a fair and honest review.

Reviews.Title: 3 months of excellent proformance so far
Reviews.Author: T. Parks "MegaRamsey"
Reviews.Content: I got my first HooToo camera for my chicken coop!  I was new to IP Cam's and had trouble understanding set up so I wrote to HooToo.  They replied quickly and were very nice and complete in their support answers.This cam has preformed very well even in temps in the single digits out there in the coop.  It works as well as a FosCam one I bought shortly afterward for our office.  The price and support for this HooToo cam makes it my choice for yet another purchase today.  I want to add this one to my security system because it has audio.  I'm looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: email: non-gmail servers don't seem to work
Reviews.Author: wb
Reviews.Content: it seems to be the same camera as a Foscam 8910w as does the web interface, to a large degree. though the hootoo has slots for SD and SIM, these are blocked. that isn't my complaint. my complaint is email. i can get smtp email to work via my gmail account using TLS protocol but i don't want to use gmail. i have other accounts and for whatever reason(s), smtp email from either camera doesn't work with those accounts. yet i can login to those email accounts via a windows client, linux (thunderbird client) or web browser. and neither logs show squat. ok, they are inexpensive cams, i get that. but gee, logs could show something. beats me why gmail TLS works but not to non-gmail systems.

Reviews.Title: Good IP Camera
Reviews.Author: Lincoln
Reviews.Content: I bought this IP camera to cover more rooms. I already have a D-link IP camera(DCS-930L). This IP camera has same price but more features. I hated to install any apps in my PC, so just wired the IP camera to router, check IP address, then used browser to visit 'http://  ip_camera_ip_address' to setup up everything. User Name: "admin" and password: "" - I didn't check manual. Finished all setup(IP camera and router) in 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: caught my neighborhood package theif
Reviews.Author: Lorans
Reviews.Content: I got this as a gift from a friend because I've been complaining about my constant neighbor who I suspect was stealing my packages off my back patio. Thanks to this and my friend, I was able to catch the crook.The camera worked great out of the box. I'm not that great with networking, but I am able to understand the basics and this with the instructions included was helpful enough to get me recording. The web interface works great. I'm able to log in remotely from work to check up on things at home. I'm also able to check remotely on my phone as well. Worked great during the day and night too. Images were clearer than I expected from a cheaper branded camera.I actually had some problems setting up the timer (the period of when I want motion detection to kick in and record) so I called in customer support and talked to Raymond. Great guy. It was a pretty simple question and he did the setup for me and I was good in a few minutes. Thank you Hootoo because I was able to submit my recording to the cops and got this thief arrested. Turns out this guy lives a few blocks away and was caught doing the same thing to other neighbors too.

Reviews.Title: No mac support.
Reviews.Author: Patrick Poziwilko
Reviews.Content: The hardware looked good.  The install disk that accompanied the product did not have a mac version of the install software. The product operated quite will wired, but could not get it to operate on the wi-fi.  There is no help on the web site, no telephone number, and the email address given for support did not respond to emails.  Hoo Too appears to be another organization that sell, period.

Reviews.Title: Great set up I bought two
Reviews.Author: VickiB
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these and am tech savvy enough to be dangerous to myself and anyone sharing with me. I was able to get these guys up and running to my home network but requires the assistance of Sunvalley to get it set up for outside network access. They promptly returned my call both times for tech help and finished the job for me I would highly recommend this camera and the company behind it.

Reviews.Title: The One to Get!
Reviews.Author: ROb
Reviews.Content: HooToo® HT-IP210F (Black)Pros:Simple setup via included CD or via your browserPan & Tilt is very rapid and up to 320° panIR cut filter means actual colors during daylight hours- no more purple trees!3.6mm wide angle lensCons:Can't really find any with this model.... it worked 100% perfect right out of the box.Comments:I probably have about 10 ip cams now- so setup is easy for me because they're all pretty much the same after you've done a few.I don't use the setup CD- I just logged into the cams GUI at 192.168.1.101 with Internet Explorer and proceeded from there. If I was new to ip cams- I would use the included setup CD. You need to let I.E. install the Active-X software in order to use the cam with I.E., if you're going to use it with Firefox- you need to let the cam install it's sw via server push mode. Both browsers work- but I.E. works better as with most all ip cams.This model (HT-IP210F) has the 3.6mm lens rather than the common 6mm lens found on some other models. That means you get a much wider field of view with this camera vs the cameras with a 6mm lens. Our old 6mm lens ip cam only covered part of our parking lot at work. This model with the 3.6mm lens has a wide enough view to cover the whole lot without panning.This model also has the IR cut filter that automatically kicks in during daylight conditions so you get actual blue skies and green trees and grass rather than purple trees/grass with cams that don't have the IR cut filter.This model also pans a full 320° which makes it easier to mount vs the common 270° cams- I have ours actually mounted 90° to the window for fitment but due to it's 320° pan range- I can still see full right and left out the window.The base of this model seems much heavier than previous ip cams- helps keep it anchored.New slimmer design seems a bit more sturdy and heavier too compared to most generic ip cams.I had the opportunity to contact HooToo support. I was pleasantly surprised in how responsive and helpful they were. Better than the company that makes our hi-def security cams that cost 5x as much as the HooToo ip cam.Overall I can't see why anyone would spend more on the other big name in ip cams when HooToo is considerably less money with a good product and good customer support.

Reviews.Title: Great Product and Great Tech Support
Reviews.Author: jesus caballero
Reviews.Content: So I got the camera, the first thing i did was drop it to the concrete floor! and after a pretty hard hit worked perfectly. then I had a hard time connecting the camera to the router and tech support Raymond Kwan from Sunvalley-tek Customer Care did a great job setting everything up for me via remote connection!FIVE STAR PRODUCT + FIVE STAR CUSTOMER SERVICEWILL DEFINITELY BUY MORE CAMERAS!

Reviews.Title: HooToo 210 IP Camera
Reviews.Author: ed775
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera in March of 2013 and set it up for both local router and internet access (using IP Cam Viewer).  It had worked better than other cameras I have had, but one day the DDNS (used for internet access) stopped working.  I cycled the power and reset it, but still no internet access.  All other things worked great.  I e-mailed HooToo support and explained them the problem.  Within one day, they e-mailed back an answer with three different options to fix the problem.  I tried the first one and all is working great.  Very good customer support and I will buy from them again.

Reviews.Title: very good indoor wireless camera
Reviews.Author: alex
Reviews.Content: The HooToo HT-IP210F wireless is a good product. Very well built, looking good too.Setup is pretty much the same as for other HooToo cameras. It is very easy to install for access from inside the network. It takes some time and basic network knowledge to make it work right with outside access, but once you figure out how to set up one camera - the others will go easy. Do not give up, read the manual, find some tips on the internet. There are some useful reviews for this camera and/or similar ones. And, of course, there is customer service, which is very helpful.If you plan to run up wirelessly, make sure the router/camera connection/location set right. The frame rate depends greatly on signal quality.Do not forget to check the focus, play with the length a bit.I would recommend to use it with Foscam Blue Iris program. It is much more powerful than the soft that comes with the camera. As well, you can sign up (free) with no-ip dynamic DNS service - very usefull to beat ever changing IPs from your router.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Customer Service!!!
Reviews.Author: ~T
Reviews.Content: I NEVER do these online reviews, but after receiving some of THE BEST technical/customer service in my life ... Well there's a first time for everything!I purchased the HooToo IP210F and have been EXTREMELY SATISFIED with it.  When it comes to networking and such, I'm the least techie person out there.  So I knew I had a big challenge in front of me when I purchased this product, when it came to installation.  To make matters worse, I've got a Mac Mini which doesn't have a CD drive to install the software that comes with it.  I emailed their tech support, and was promptly responded to.  After some suggestions that didn't lead to a resolution, they recommended I get in touch with "Raymond."  This guy was Superman on the phone while helping me install this on my Mac.  He stayed late after his scheduled shift and took his time in walking me thru complete installation.  He even took the time to show me some of the features.  Just exceptional technical support!!  The BEST I've ever received!!!If your worried about buying this product because your a non-techie ... Don't be worried.  They have an EXCELLENT technical/customer service staff to walk you through it!~ T

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera!
Reviews.Author: Wildcat Smer
Reviews.Content: The quality of the camera is great and it isn't too painful to setup if you have some tech saaviness. I have five Hoo-Too cameras around the house (inside and outside). I don't have Ethernet throughout the house, so the wi-fi is key. The camera is very flexible to operate outside of the house.Their customer service is awesome. I had one issue with a part and they handled it immediate and sent me a replacement without any hassle.Consideration for Mac and iOS users: The software isn't very Mac or iOS friendly. The only browser that supports seeing all cameras at one time in a grid is IE (because it requires ActiveX...hence Windows only).

Reviews.Title: Affordable and Effective!
Reviews.Author: Aaron K. Dinette
Reviews.Content: I must say that I am very happy with my purchase of this product!  We have been looking for a wireless camera to use as a monitor for our baby's room to watch him at night to make sure he is sleeping soundly and to keep an eye on things.  The night vision on this camera is completely awesome!  Plus, with motion control - there is pretty much no limit to what you can look at in front of the camera and a good ways to either side!  Wireless connectivity and setup was completely simple!  There are also some pretty cool third party apps for the iPhone that connect up with this camera, thus turning my iPhone into a remote viewer/monitor with ease!  HooToo also provides an app - but I've actually found some others that seem to work better!Anyways - if you're looking for an affordable night-vision solution with audio and don't require Zoom capabilities, give this camera consideration.  You won't be sorry!Cheers!

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised
Reviews.Author: WCD
Reviews.Content: This camera works exactly as expected.  The instructions could use a little work, but the set up is pretty basic.  Once it is up and running you get a very good wide field of view.  I am able to see the entire area around my daughter's crib.I would highly recommend using an IP Cam app to view the video on your phone or tablet.  It is much smoother, and easier to set up than the web interface.  Of course, I also use FireFox to view the camera if I happen to be on my desktop computer.As a baby monitor, I think it holds up quite well!

Reviews.Title: Camera worked using Ethernet but could not make the wireless connection work
Reviews.Content: I didn't like this product.  The install was tricky as I am running Windows 7 64-bit and the install disk did not have the correct software.  Ended up going to the website, downloading the right software, and then upgrading the bios.Once I did all that I was able to make the camera work using an Ethernet connection.  I could see / control the camera no problem using my network.  I was never able to make the camera connect using my wireless network which reduced the utility.One other strange issue.  I was not able to connect via my android smartphone. Not sure what the problem was.  Ultimately returned the product after trying to contact the tech support via phone and not being able to get through to them.

Reviews.Title: not to bad,I returned it but I could of just had a bad one
Reviews.Author: Colleen E. Wiles "devin wiles"
Reviews.Content: great colors actually real life color scheme compared to hootoo ip cam i bought a  year back which seemed to only show dull colors. but when i got this one an i started rotating it would only go to the right like when i clicked left it went to the right and also when i hit right it went to the right but if you patrol it vertically it'll fix that lil bug but gets annoying. Also now Ive only had it for 2 nights but ive had to flash my phone light in it both times for the night vision to kick on other wise it'll just be pitch black. Also the talk is so quite and you cant listen an talk at the same time or its all noisy and static sounding. I'm thinking bout returning and just paying extra dollar for a better one idk but i really dont feel like going through the process of return.

Reviews.Title: No customer support.
Reviews.Author: Lenmy Pelc
Reviews.Content: I can not even get the software to install on my computer.  I am using windows 7.  I tried to call their customer support and it said to leave name and number which I did. Still waiting to be called.  Maybe all they have is an answering machine and no humans working there.  I will try again today if I can not get through to customer support then it is being shipped back.  If the print on the instructions was any smaller you would need a telescope to read them.

Reviews.Title: Does not work with all windows software!!!
Reviews.Author: magnetman
Reviews.Content: "Unable to load Software CD on a Windows 7 64 Bit computer! Tried to contact Hootoo help but it is virtually noexistence. After spending hours, I switched to my wife's Vista laptop and was able to load software from there. CD Software will not run on a windows 7 64 bit unit which Hootoo fails to tell you! Gave them 2 stars since I was able to back it into my 64 bit computer, but without audio! Also, Hootoo supplies a card with each purchase that shows you how to get 10 percent back on the purchase price (through a Amazon gift email card)if you show proof of submitting a positive review for their product. That's why there are so many 5 star reviews for this product!"

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Customer Service After Issues
Reviews.Author: C.M. Spencer
Reviews.Content: **4/1/14 Update - Sunvalleytek Customer Service (specifically, Bruce) went over and above to satisfy me by shipping a second unit.  After a few days of testing the second unit it does not appear to have the same issues outlined below I had with the first unit.  At this point, I'm willing to accept that the problems with the first unit is not indicative of all units.  Based on the second unit and the outstanding customer service I received I've changing my initial review of one star to five stars and would recommend Sunvalleytek as a top notch seller and HooToo as a solid product.**It was a challenge but I managed to set the camera on my network (wired and wireless) and everything appeared to be working great until I attempted to pan.  The pan motor (left and right) does not fully move when not on a flat surface.  Mounting the camera at any angle, even with the provided mount and it will not rotate/pan properly.  When I put an ear close to the camera I can hear the servo motor trying to engage and pan but the camera won't move.However, since I'm using the camera primarily as a static baby camera I could have dealt with the lack of the pan working properly.  The real issue is (and the one I simply can't over look and why its getting 1 star) is when the CAMERA RANDOMLY REBOOTS.  It has a constant power source, solid network connection and often (like 5 times/cycles in 20 minutes of watching my child) it will turn off, turn on again after a few seconds and then go through its usual 30 second boot test of pan/tilt.  Then (and even more frustrating) when the camera is testing after booting it does not get "stuck" panning, which makes no sense to me!When the camera works like it should the aspects that initially drew me to buying this camera like image quality, value, connectivity, IR cut, etc. are great, outstanding even, but having it randomly rebooting on me is infuriating and honestly a deal breaker and satisfaction killer.  Ultimately, my suggestion would be to look elsewhere as I am very disappointed with this item.

Reviews.Title: had one
Reviews.Author: dave
Reviews.Content: i had one hootoo camera and it works well. when i wanted another i went back to hootoo.two more words.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Ali Sina
Reviews.Content: Title: Great cameraThis camera is good alternative for a DVR because the footage is not stored on the camera on a hard disk. On a DVR if a thief locates your camera system and steals the entire unit, you are SOL. However this camera gets stolen, you will have pictures/videos saved in your email. I run a operate a small business that sells cell phone accessories, and have this camera set up so that it takes snapshots every time a customer walks by. Best of a all, it can get be setup wirelessly.

Reviews.Title: Great customer service
Reviews.Author: Emmijay
Reviews.Content: I just received my camera and the set up is very complicated if you want to be able to use all the features, however customer service was GREAT and I mean Great they were able to walk through all of it they were very patient and actually seemed to want to help.  The camera itself seem to work just as stated and the quality is good for the price.  I am very pleased with this product and hope that it continues to function this good for the long term.

Reviews.Title: Love This Camera & the Tech Support Behind it!
Reviews.Author: Penny
Reviews.Content: I've owned my IP210F camera for a couple years now.  I'm not a real computer savvy person but know enough to be able to follow directions.  This camera installed easily on my then XP machines & worked flawlessly.  I used Internet Explorer to connect & have it connected via ethernet as my wirelss router was too far away for wireless connection (over 100' through many walls).  Recently though, I upgraded my computers to Win7 64 bit & could no longer connect to my camera.  IE 10 is all that will run on the Win7 OS.  I contacted CS at HooToo & Raymond called me as I requested & walked me through the easy steps to victory once again!  This time using Google Chrome as my browser.Not only does this camera perform to my expectations but the knowledgeable & courteous tech support makes this camera purchase well worth it.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with product
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with my purchase. This camera is a very good product to buy. The quality of the video is very good! And what i liked the most is that the lens of the camera can be turned around up an down as you convenience. Even the servicefrom the company was great. I called the company to get some help on setting up  my internet modem and the technician helped me with all my questions. Very good product and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT CAMERA & SUPPORT
Reviews.Author: TrueSuccessOne
Reviews.Content: This Hoo Too 210F ip camera provides a very clear image on my phone and tablet. Raymond of Hoo Too support has been very helpful in setting up the camera since I first received it and more recently, when I had a problem accessing the ip cam app over my phone when wi-fi was not available. He checked out my camera and system remotely and this indicated to me that it was a setting on my phone (Not the Hoo Too camera) that was causing the problem. The setting that was unchecked was "use mobile network to get data when wi-fi is not available". I then checked this and everything has been working beautifully. Raymond's expertise eliminated possible causes and led me quickly to this solution. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: HooToo
Reviews.Author: Porkchop007
Reviews.Content: I now have three Hootoo camera's and so far they have been working okay. Only one of the HT-IP210 gave be some problems with wireless setup. I was able to fix the problem but the only problem I am unable to fix is switching between cameras, when I switch between cameras my wireless internet gets knocked off then I have to reboot it. Other than that this is a pretty good camera.

Reviews.Title: Great product great support Analyst
Reviews.Author: tonycalderon
Reviews.Content: Great products great support team working with Raymond Raymond was a pleasure what a professional what a helpful educating support analyst prompt response all my calls thank you so much for having such a supportive supporter at this company and funny Will have to buy more products because of Raymond Raymond

Reviews.Title: HooToo HT-IP210F IP Wireless Camera
Reviews.Author: rob
Reviews.Content: It is a great ip camera for the price.The people at the HooToo Company are also good.Recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: Decent low end camera.
Reviews.Author: MJM "Mike"
Reviews.Content: This is my first IP camera and for the most part it was a good buy.The instructions are a little sparse, but there are plenty of references online for these types of cameras.I was able to get wireless setup using my password that has has symbols. I had read that this may not work, but I had no problem.Also, my sid is not broadcasted and that also did not present a problem.So far, the camera has operated without issue, no reboots, no loss of network, audio works ok, movement is quite, etc.Picture quality is mediocre, but I guess this is typical of cameras in this class.Some of the features on this camera seem a little behind the others, like: No manual control or override of IR lights No https No way to turn off built in ddns (who knows where it is sending your IP address!, had to block this at firewall)Hopefully some of these will be addressed in a future firmware release?

Reviews.Title: Ok camera
Reviews.Author: garyznola
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is a pretty good camera.  The audio is not very good but you can hear it.  The night vision is not what I hoped for with the number of LEDs this camera has and it seems to be focused instead of defused across the viewing area.  And occasionally I have to reboot it to get the night vision to come back on in the evening.  But even with these negatives the picture is clear and crisp even at night, without the dreaded halo.  The pan tilt works well.  Even though this is an indoor camera, I have this camera outside under an eave and so far it is doing really well.  So despite the couple of issues i havebhad with this camera it performs pretty well and you can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: hootoo ht-ip210f review
Reviews.Author: Teddy
Reviews.Content: The parts of setting up the wired connection and Wi-Fi are very straight-forward, and the supplied software worked perfectly on my Mac book pro running OS x lion and Airport Extreme.The difficult part comes in setting up remote capabilities for viewing from iPhone or other remote device. The directions speak of getting free DDNS service at dyndns.com for a free host name. Unfortunately the host name I registered from dyndns.com never work and I ended up using Hootoo's free host name (e.g. g0001.gipcam.com), I put a port number 8080 for the camera and matched it up on my router.Others:Other than the manual (which is obviously translated from an Asian dialect into English as the verbiage is oddly worded), I have to admit that the camera and remote applications are quite good. I am now able to view, control and listen remotely, whatever from my iPhone or from web.I'm so thrilled to get the audio function to work for me as it is so necessary to me, I mounted the camera on the wall just above the clock and this turns out to be a very good location. The clock provides a constant tick-tock sound that ensures me that the audio is functioning.

Reviews.Title: Hard to set up
Reviews.Author: Starr L. Marshall "Twynkle"
Reviews.Content: Hard to figure out to set it up...the directions are just not very clear and the camera is small.  Not worth the trouble.

Reviews.Title: Very unprofessional item!!
Reviews.Author: Camera guy
Reviews.Content: I have bought hootoo HT-IP210 from Amazon. Ti's one of the worst item that I have ever bought.Amazon totally disappointed me.The item seems match the picture on the website, it's lovely. However, you willsuddenly change your mind after using it. Not lovely at all, simply it's a devil.Firstly, it's the user Manual. As a native American, I can hardly understand it. It'sridiculous. Certainly it's not written by native Americans, I think. Thank god, I'm anITer.I can let it work in my experience, even with no Manual, but what happened nextastonished me.My computer is running on 64-bit Windows 7. The first time I watch the Video withIE browser, somehow the computer died, I have to restart it. After a long time ofstudy, finally I found what the problem is. It's the active-X, one of the necessaryinstallation programs. I tried with another computer, same happened. Obviously, thefirmware of current version can't support my operating system very well.So I contact Hootoo for help. Their website is awesome, but I didn't find the rightmodel. I doubt if I bought a fake item. No surprise, I didn't find the suitable firmwareand software.I tried to contact customer service, they replied, however they don't seem to understand the problem.After all these, I did some research. Thanks Google, I found so many peopleencounter the same problem. After series of complex setups, finally the device workswith Firefox and Buleiris, although some features are still not working. The problemstill exists. I have no time to write details here, if you need help, just email me. As Itook such a long time on the software and setup, the quality of product worried me alot. And the facts turn out, I'm right.First of all, the night version is 15 feet at the most, it can never reach 40 feet, but itis clearly shown in the Manual. And the video quality at night is really poor, witha lot of noise. Secondly, it can't achieve the so called two ways audio in Firefoxand Buleiris. Thirdly, the video frames even can't reach 15fps, neither at 640*480resolutions nor 320*240, let alone30fps. Indeed, sometimes it will be frozen. It'snot the problem of internet because I'm using 10M ADSL. My pc and device areconnected directly to a Gigabit RouterAs I said, I couldn't reach Hootoo. Before I wrote this comment, I think I wastricked by them. Thank Google, I did some research and found a link.[...]See it hereDon't be tricked by the beautiful website and misleading description.Hootoo sent me a card in the package. it says if I leave 5 stars feedback, they will giveme 10% discount. Now, you know how they get so many 5 stars? I want 1 million,can they afford it? Between money and integrity, I can easily make the decision, thelatter. I have contacted Amazon to send it back.At last, it's just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: Not 802.11n capable.
Reviews.Author: A. Person
Reviews.Content: Although the product seemed to work fine on 802.11g, I use 802.11n exclusively.  This product (although the manufacturer's website also states that it is 802.11n capable) is not 802.11n capable.  Since I have wasted time and money to come to this conclusion, I wanted to write this review to save somebody else the wasted effort.  It does seem to work well enough on 802.11g, although it is a little bigger than I expected, and it did make a little noise when moving.  Installation is simple enough for people familiar with networking.  It also has an installation cd for those persons who are a little less technically inclined.  If you have any issues, there are reviews of similar cameras that have helpful hints, and even a few YouTube videos that can be helpful.  Google "IP camera installation".

Reviews.Title: You have to love a project.
Reviews.Author: barry bresnick
Reviews.Content: I hoped to set this up the day before leaving on vacation. That was a mistake. Not being a techie, configuring router and camera and syncing wasn't easy. Then I had to change several Windows settings for it to operate and then more settings for video to appear. By then it was midnight and it was another big deal to setup motion detection with email alerts. This is definitely not plug and play. I'm now scared off from buying another brand because they probably are all this difficult. The direction are OK if you have a magnifying glass to read size 4 font. Really?? I hired someone to watch the house.

Reviews.Title: WORKS GREAT!!!
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: The  camera works great to monitor the inside of your home.  I purchased the camera to view the house when my alarm is triggered to make sure that it is not a false alarm. I had some  problems setting the port forward thing using the Internet Explorer browser but I called tech support and spoke to Raymond and he was Great getting everything set up for viewing on home PC, Netbook and smart phone in a short period of time.  He's very patient and knowledgeable. I wish it could record to a built in SD card though.  Anyhow I just ordered 2 more and I am very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Re-review on HooToo HT-IP210F IP Camera
Reviews.Author: newblsh
Reviews.Content: Thanks for Jay from customer support quickly responding and taking care of my complaint. Shortly after my complaint, we got a replacement of the device. So far, I have done a full test on the new device. Here is an update from my last review after we got the replacement.The new device has much improvement than previous one in most of the aspects even they have the same model. I also noticed that the firmware of this device is newer than the latest one published in Hootoo.com. Maybe this makes the big difference, or the last device we got was a defect one.Pros:1. Wireless connection:  For the new device, it access distance is greater than 30 feet and there are 3 walls between the device and wireless router. I tried to put the device outdoor and the connection was still great even there is a brick wall between. The access distance is much longer than that of the last device.2. Night vision. This device also works great when there is little or no light indoor and outdoor (also 30+ feet away from wireless router). This is amazing to me. And it is much, much better than that of last device.3. The quality of live video is better that of last one. If this can be improved (to 720p or so), that will be better. I know the price of the product will also be increased accordingly.4. The Alarm Service and Mail Service work as expected and easy to setup. 6 images will be sent in each Upload Interval to your email account when a motion is detected. This feature allows you to get a real-time notification when you are not watching the Live Video while away from home and you have access to your email (on mobile or office computer) and email notification is turned on.5. Live Video through Internet access (remote access while away from home) works as well as it works in home computer on home network.6. The new device has been up and running for more than two weeks. So far, the Live Video has been working continuously without problem.7. The IPCamClient software works with the new device.Cons:1. The IPCamClient software has some bug. The left and right arrows on the dial panel on the GUI are reverted, which is opposite to what shows on the Firefox. These buttons on the dial pans on different software should operate in the same way. Also those arrows do not work smoothly on Firefox and IPCamClient.2. When light is not evenly distributed in a place/room, the live video does not provide good result (blurry/snow) as it does in a place with evenly light, or without light, or outdoor.3. No logout function can be found yet. Logout function is needed if the computer and mobile phone used for monitoring is accessible by others for some reasons.So far, I like this IP camera. It is much better that previous one. It would be even better if above Cons could be fixed. I would recommend this device to others.=================================Previous reviewI chose this IP camera based on the average customer reviews. From my experience, this product is not worth to own. I don't understand how this product could get so high review rating.Here are the reasons why I don't like this camera:1. With wireless connection, The IP camera works within the distance of Ethernet cable from wireless router. But, it stops taking live video in both Firefox Server Push mode and VLC mode after the camera is moved to 15 ~ 20 feet away from router. The live video window shows complete dark. Some of my home computers are much further away from the wireless router and they connect to the Internet without problem.2.  Live video is very blurry when it works and is far away from what HooToo claims "high quality digital video", and it does not have real 640*480 quality. In the place with little light, the live video is almost useless. Foscam FI8910W has higher quality video than HooToo HT-IP210F in 640*480 resolution.3.  Does not work with 64 bit IE at all.4. IPCamClient software does not work even the IP camera is connected to the router with a Ethernet cable and when live video works in Firefox.5. Nowhere in the document says how to make static IP to work wireless with a router. The static IP is needed for an IP camera in a home network when accessing the IP camera from Internet.It wasted time.

Reviews.Title: Broken returned for RMA and not posted
Reviews.Author: Randall J Joslin
Reviews.Content: Got this thing and first thing out of the box and installed all it would do is point straight up in the air and swivel left and right.  Never worked properly.  I returned for RMA and see it was never posted.

Reviews.Title: Would not purchase again
Reviews.Author: Cynthia T. Turner "Word Lover"
Reviews.Content: Never could get it to work properly. Too complicated. I'm no techie, but I'm not ignorant. I can assemble most things even after a while. This one, no go.

ProductInfo.Features:
View a live camera from anywhere in the world via any browser, remote viewing & control from any smart phone, tablet or computer in the World
Expand your survey area with motorized Pan/Tilt (various pan/tilt speeds from 1 to 10), 15 Preset positions viewing
Multi-platform support (NOT supporting 64bit IE), 16-LEDs nigh vision - In well-lit areas, it provides crisp, full color video during, In darker conditions, the camera automatically enables Night Vision, adjusting so you can see in incredibly low lighting levels down to 0.5 lux (almost complete darkness)
Advance video motion detection with sound alerts, instant email with 6-8 snapshots so you know when something is going on
Built-in audio support for two-way communication (Talk through the camera from anywhere in the world. Want to surprise an intruder or remind your teen at home that it's homework time? Just click the 'talk' tab and do it!)
ProductInfo.Name: HooToo® HT-IP210F Wireless IP Network Surveillance Camera (Black, 16-LED Night Vision, Two-way Audio, Email Alerts)
